description.short: Unique label for code cell
description.long:
Unique label for code cell. Used when other code needs to refer to the cell 
(e.g. for cross references `fig-samples` or `tbl-summary`)

schema/cell-attributes.yml.name: classes
schema/cell-attributes.yml.description: Classes to apply to cell container

schema/cell-attributes.yml.name: tags
schema/cell-attributes.yml.description: Array of tags for notebook cell

description.short: Notebook cell identifier
description.long:
Notebook cell identifier. Note that if there is no cell `id` then `label` 
will be used as the cell `id` if it is present.
See <https://jupyter.org/enhancement-proposals/62-cell-id/cell-id.html>
for additional details on cell ids.

description.short: Whether to cache a code chunk.
description.long:
Whether to cache a code chunk. When evaluating
code chunks for the second time, the cached chunks are skipped (unless they
have been modified), but the objects created in these chunks are loaded from
previously saved databases (`.rdb` and `.rdx` files), and these files are
saved when a chunk is evaluated for the first time, or when cached files are
not found (e.g., you may have removed them by hand). Note that the filename
consists of the chunk label with an MD5 digest of the R code and chunk
options of the code chunk, which means any changes in the chunk will produce
a different MD5 digest, and hence invalidate the cache.

schema/cell-cache.yml.name: cache-path
schema/cell-cache.yml.description: A prefix to be used to generate the paths of cache files

description.short: Variable names to be saved in the cache database.
description.long:
Variable names to be saved in
the cache database. By default, all variables created in the current chunks
are identified and saved, but you may want to manually specify the variables
to be saved, because the automatic detection of variables may not be robust,
or you may want to save only a subset of variables.

description.short: Variables names that are not created from the current chunk
description.long:
Variables names that are not created from the current chunk.

This option is mainly for `autodep: true` to work more precisely---a chunk
`B` depends on chunk `A` when any of `B`'s global variables are `A`'s local 
variables. In case the automatic detection of global variables in a chunk 
fails, you may manually specify the names of global variables via this option.
In addition, `cache-globals: false` means detecting all variables in a code
chunk, no matter if they are global or local variables.

description.short: Whether to `lazyLoad()` or directly `load()` objects
description.long:
Whether to `lazyLoad()` or directly `load()` objects. For very large objects, 
lazyloading may not work, so `cache-lazy: false` may be desirable (see
[#572](https://github.com/yihui/knitr/issues/572)).

schema/cell-cache.yml.name: cache-rebuild
schema/cell-cache.yml.description: Force rebuild of cache for chunk

schema/cell-cache.yml.name: cache-comments
schema/cell-cache.yml.description: Prevent comment changes from invalidating the cache for a chunk

schema/cell-cache.yml.name: dependson
schema/cell-cache.yml.description: Explicitly specify cache dependencies for this chunk (one or more chunk labels)

schema/cell-cache.yml.name: autodep
schema/cell-cache.yml.description: Detect cache dependencies automatically via usage of global variables

description.short: Evaluate code cells (if `false` just echos the code into output).
description.long:
Evaluate code cells (if `false` just echos the code into output).

- `true` (default): evaluate code cell
- `false`: don't evaluate code cell
- `[...]`: A list of positive or negative line numbers to selectively include or exclude lines 
  (explicit inclusion/excusion of lines is available only when using the knitr engine)

description.short: Include cell source code in rendered output.
description.long:
Include cell source code in rendered output.

- `true` (default): include source code in output
- `false`: do not include source code in output
- `fenced`: in addition to echoing, include the cell delimiter as part of the output.
- `[...]`: A list of positive or negative line numbers to selectively include or exclude lines
  (explicit inclusion/excusion of lines is available only when using the knitr engine)

description.short: Collapse code into an HTML `<details>` tag so the user can display it on-demand.
description.long:
Collapse code into an HTML `<details>` tag so the user can display it on-demand.

- `true`: collapse code
- `false` (default): do not collapse code
- `show`: use the `<details>` tag, but show the expanded code initially.

schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.name: code-summary
schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.description: Summary text to use for code blocks collapsed using `code-fold`

description.short: Choose whether to `scroll` or `wrap` when code lines are too wide for their container.
description.long:
Choose how to handle code overflow, when code lines are too wide for their container. One of:

- `scroll`
- `wrap`

schema.errorDescription: be `true`, `false`, or a string specifying the lines to highlight

description.short: Include line numbers in code block output (`true` or `false`)
description.long:
Include line numbers in code block output (`true` or `false`).

For revealjs output only, you can also specify a string to highlight
specific lines (and/or animate between sets of highlighted lines).

* Sets of lines are denoted with commas:
  * `3,4,5`
  * `1,10,12`
* Ranges can be denoted with dashes and combined with commas:
  * `1-3,5` 
  * `5-10,12,14`
* Finally, animation steps are separated by `|`:
  * `1-3|1-3,5` first shows `1-3`, then `1-3,5`
  * `|5|5-10,12` first shows no numbering, then 5, then lines 5-10
    and 12

schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.name: lst-label
schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.description: Unique label for code listing (used in cross references)

schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.name: tidy-opts
schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.description: List of options to pass to `tidy` handler

schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.name: collapse
schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.description: Collapse all the source and output blocks from one code chunk into a single block

description.short: Whether to add the prompt characters in R code.
description.long:
Whether to add the prompt characters in R
code. See `prompt` and `continue` on the help page `?base::options`. Note
that adding prompts can make it difficult for readers to copy R code from
the output, so `prompt: false` may be a better choice. This option may not
work well when the `engine` is not `R`
([#1274](https://github.com/yihui/knitr/issues/1274)).

schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.name: highlight
schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.description: Whether to syntax highlight the source code

schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.name: class-source
schema/cell-codeoutput.yml.description: Class name(s) for source code blocks

schema/cell-figure.yml.name: fig-alt
schema/cell-figure.yml.description: Alternative text to be used in the `alt` attribute of HTML images.

description.short: LaTeX figure position arrangement to be used in `\begin{figure}[]`.
description.long:
LaTeX figure position arrangement to be used in `\begin{figure}[]`.

Computational figure output that is accompanied by the code 
that produced it is given a default value of `fig-pos="H"` (so 
that the code and figure are not inordinately separated).

If `fig-pos` is `false`, then we don't use any figure position
specifier, which is sometimes necessary with custom figure
environments (such as `sidewaysfigure`).

description.short: A short caption (only used in LaTeX output)
description.long:
A short caption (only used in LaTeX output). A short caption is inserted in `\caption[]`, 
and usually displayed in the “List of Figures” of a PDF document.

schema/cell-figure.yml.name: fig-format
schema/cell-figure.yml.description: Default output format for figures (`retina`, `png`, `jpeg`, `svg`, or `pdf`)

schema/cell-figure.yml.name: fig-asp
schema/cell-figure.yml.description:
The aspect ratio of the plot, i.e., the ratio of height/width. When `fig-asp` is specified, the height of a plot 
(the option `fig-height`) is calculated from `fig-width * fig-asp`.

description.short: Width of plot in the output document
description.long:
Width of the plot in the output document, which can be different from its physical `fig-width`,
i.e., plots can be scaled in the output document.
When used without a unit, the unit is assumed to be pixels. However, any of the following unit 
identifiers can be used: px, cm, mm, in, inch and %, for example, `3in`, `8cm`, `300px` or `50%`.

description.short: Height of plot in the output document
description.long:
Height of the plot in the output document, which can be different from its physical `fig-height`, 
i.e., plots can be scaled in the output document.
Depending on the output format, this option can take special values.
For example, for LaTeX output, it can be `3in`, or `8cm`;
for HTML, it can be `300px`.

description.short: How plots in chunks should be kept.
description.long:
How plots in chunks should be kept. Possible values are as follows:

-   `high`: Only keep high-level plots (merge low-level changes into
    high-level plots).
-   `none`: Discard all plots.
-   `all`: Keep all plots (low-level plot changes may produce new plots).
-   `first`: Only keep the first plot.
-   `last`: Only keep the last plot.
-   A numeric vector: In this case, the values are indices of (low-level) plots
    to keep.

description.short: How to show/arrange the plots
description.long:
How to show/arrange the plots. Possible values are as follows:

-   `asis`: Show plots exactly in places where they were generated (as if
    the code were run in an R terminal).
-   `hold`: Hold all plots and output them at the end of a code chunk.
-   `animate`: Concatenate all plots into an animation if there are multiple
    plots in a chunk.
-   `hide`: Generate plot files but hide them in the output document.

schema/cell-figure.yml.name: out-extra
schema/cell-figure.yml.description: Additional raw LaTeX or HTML options to be applied to figures

schema/cell-figure.yml.name: sanitize
schema/cell-figure.yml.description: sanitize tikz graphics (escape special LaTeX characters).

schema/cell-figure.yml.name: interval
schema/cell-figure.yml.description: Time interval (number of seconds) between animation frames.

description.short: Extra options for animations
description.long:
Extra options for animations; see the documentation of the LaTeX [**animate**
package.](http://ctan.org/pkg/animate)

description.short: Hook function to create animations in HTML output
description.long:
Hook function to create animations in HTML output. 

The default hook (`ffmpeg`) uses FFmpeg to convert images to a WebM video.

Another hook function is `gifski` based on the
[**gifski**](https://cran.r-project.org/package=gifski) package to
create GIF animations.

schema/cell-include.yml.name: child
schema/cell-include.yml.description: One or more paths of child documents to be knitted and input into the main document.

schema/cell-include.yml.name: file
schema/cell-include.yml.description: File containing code to execute for this chunk

schema/cell-include.yml.name: code
schema/cell-include.yml.description: String containing code to execute for this chunk

schema/cell-include.yml.name: purl
schema/cell-include.yml.description: Include chunk when extracting code with `knitr::purl()`

description.short: 2d-array of widths where the first dimension specifies columns and the second rows.
description.long:
2d-array of widths where the first dimension specifies columns and the second rows.

For example, to layout the first two output blocks side-by-side on the top with the third
block spanning the full width below, use `[[3,3], [1]]`.

Use negative values to create margin. For example, to create space between the 
output blocks in the top row of the previous example, use `[[3,-1, 3], [1]]`.

schema/cell-layout.yml.name: layout-align
schema/cell-layout.yml.description: Horizontal alignment for layout content (`default`, `left`, `right`, or `center`)

schema/cell-layout.yml.name: layout-valign
schema/cell-layout.yml.description: Vertical alignment for layout content (`default`, `top`, `center`, or `bottom`)

description.short: Page column for output
description.long: [Page column](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/article-layout.html) for output

description.short: Page column for figure output
description.long: [Page column](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/article-layout.html) for figure output

description.short: Page column for table output
description.long: [Page column](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/article-layout.html) for table output

schema/cell-pagelayout.yml.name: cap-location
schema/cell-pagelayout.yml.description: Where to place figure and table captions (`top`, `bottom`, or `margin`)

schema/cell-pagelayout.yml.name: fig-cap-location
schema/cell-pagelayout.yml.description: Where to place figure captions (`top`, `bottom`, or `margin`)

schema/cell-pagelayout.yml.name: tbl-cap-location
schema/cell-pagelayout.yml.description: Where to place table captions (`top`, `bottom`, or `margin`)

description.short: Apply explicit table column widths
description.long:
Apply explicit table column widths for markdown grid tables and pipe
tables that are more than `columns` characters wide (72 by default). 

Some formats (e.g. HTML) do an excellent job automatically sizing
table columns and so don't benefit much from column width specifications.
Other formats (e.g. LaTeX) require table column sizes in order to 
correctly flow longer cell content (this is a major reason why tables 
> 72 columns wide are assigned explicit widths by Pandoc).

This can be specified as:

- `auto`: Apply markdown table column widths except when there is a
  hyperlink in the table (which tends to throw off automatic
  calculation of column widths based on the markdown text width of cells).
  (`auto` is the default for HTML output formats)

- `true`: Always apply markdown table widths (`true` is the default
  for all non-HTML formats)

- `false`: Never apply markdown table widths.

- An array of numbers (e.g. `[40, 30, 30]`): Array of explicit width percentages.

description.short:
Include the results of executing the code in the output (specify `asis` to
treat output as raw markdown with no enclosing containers).
description.long:
Include the results of executing the code in the output. Possible values:

- `true`: Include results.
- `false`: Do not include results.
- `asis`: Treat output as raw markdown with no enclosing containers.

schema/cell-textoutput.yml.name: error
schema/cell-textoutput.yml.description:
Include errors in the output (note that this implies that errors executing code
will not halt processing of the document).

schema/cell-textoutput.yml.name: include
schema/cell-textoutput.yml.description: Catch all for preventing any output (code or results) from being included in output.

description.short: Location of output relative to the code that generated it (`default`, `fragment`, `slide`, `column`, or `column-location`)
description.long:
Location of output relative to the code that generated it. The possible values are as follows:

- `default`: Normal flow of the slide after the code
- `fragment`: In a fragment (not visible until you advance)
- `slide`: On a new slide after the curent one
- 'column': In an adjacent column 
- `column-fragment`:   In an adjacent column (not visible until you advance)

Note that this option is supported only for the `revealjs` format.

description.short: How to display text results
description.long:
How to display text results. Note that this option only applies to normal text output (not warnings,
messages, or errors). The possible values are as follows:

- `markup`: Mark up text output with the appropriate environments
  depending on the output format. For example, if the text
  output is a character string `"[1] 1 2 3"`, the actual output that
  **knitr** produces will be:

  ```` md
  ```
  [1] 1 2 3
  ```
  ````

  In this case, `results: markup` means to put the text output in fenced
  code blocks (```` ``` ````).

- `asis`: Write text output as-is, i.e., write the raw text results
  directly into the output document without any markups.

  ```` md
  ```{r}
  #| results: asis
  cat("I'm raw **Markdown** content.\n")
  ```
  ````

- `hold`: Hold all pieces of text output in a chunk and flush them to the
  end of the chunk.

- `hide` (or `false`): Hide text output.

description.short: Prefix to be added before each line of text output.
description.long:
Prefix to be added before each line of text output.
By default, the text output is commented out by `##`, so if
readers want to copy and run the source code from the output document, they
can select and copy everything from the chunk, since the text output is
masked in comments (and will be ignored when running the copied text). Set
`comment: ''` to remove the default `##`.

description.short: Automatically generate sidebar contents.
description.long:
Automatically generate sidebar contents. Pass `true` to include all documents
in the site, a directory name to include only documents in that directory, 
or a glob (or list of globs) to include documents based on a pattern. 

Subdirectories will create sections (use an `index.qmd` in the directory to
provide its title). Order will be alphabetical unless a numeric `order` field
is provided in document metadata.

string.description: Accessible label for the item.
Alias for href
Link to file contained with the project or external URL

description.short: Name of bootstrap icon (e.g. `github`, `twitter`, `share`)
description.long:
Name of bootstrap icon (e.g. `github`, `twitter`, `share`)
See <https://icons.getbootstrap.com/> for a list of available icons

string.description:
Text to display for item (defaults to the
document title if not provided)
Alias for href

Value for rel attribute. Multiple space-separated values are permitted.
See <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/rel>
for a details.

Value for target attribute.
See <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target>
for details.
The Github repo that will be used to store comments.
The label that will be assigned to issues created by Utterances.

description.short: The Github theme that should be used for Utterances.
description.long:
The Github theme that should be used for Utterances
(`github-light`, `github-dark`, `github-dark-orange`,
`icy-dark`, `dark-blue`, `photon-dark`, `body-light`,
or `gruvbox-dark`)

description.short: How posts should be mapped to Github issues
description.long:
How posts should be mapped to Github issues
(`pathname`, `url`, `title` or `og:title`)

description.short: The Github repo that will be used to store comments.
description.long:
The Github repo that will be used to store comments.

In order to work correctly, the repo must be public, with the giscus app installed, and 
the discussions feature must be enabled.

description.short: The Github repository identifier.
description.long:
The Github repository identifier.

You can quickly find this by using the configuration tool at [https://giscus.app](https://giscus.app).
If this is not provided, Quarto will attempt to discover it at render time.

description.short: The discussion category where new discussions will be created.
description.long:
The discussion category where new discussions will be created. It is recommended 
to use a category with the **Announcements** type so that new discussions 
can only be created by maintainers and giscus.

description.short: The Github category identifier.
description.long:
The Github category identifier.

You can quickly find this by using the configuration tool at [https://giscus.app](https://giscus.app).
If this is not provided, Quarto will attempt to discover it at render time.

description.short: The mapping between the page and the embedded discussion.
description.long:
The mapping between the page and the embedded discussion. 

- `pathname`: The discussion title contains the page path
- `url`: The discussion title contains the page url
- `title`: The discussion title contains the page title
- `og:title`: The discussion title contains the `og:title` metadata value
- any other string or number: Any other strings will be passed through verbatim and a discussion title
containing that value will be used. Numbers will be treated
as a discussion number and automatic discussion creation is not supported.

boolean.description: Display reactions for the discussion's main post before the comments.

loading.description: Specify `loading: lazy` to defer loading comments until the user scrolls near the comments container.

input-position.description: Place the comment input box above or below the comments.

string.description: The light theme name.
The dark theme name.

theme.description: The giscus theme to use when displaying comments.

string.description: The language that should be used when displaying the commenting interface.

boolean.description: Controls whether the sidebar opens automatically on startup.

showHighlights.description: Controls whether the in-document highlights are shown by default (`always`, `whenSidebarOpen` or `never`)

theme.description: Controls the overall look of the sidebar (`classic` or `clean`)

boolean.description:
Controls whether the experimental New Note button 
should be shown in the notes tab in the sidebar.

usernameUrl.description:
Specify a URL to direct a user to, 
in a new tab. when they click on the annotation author 
link in the header of an annotation.

string.description: The base URL of the service API.
The domain name which the annotation service is associated with.
An OAuth 2 grant token which the client can send to the service in order to get an access token for making authenticated requests to the service.

boolean.description: A flag indicating whether users should be able to leave groups of which they are a member.
A flag indicating whether annotation cards should show links that take the user to see an annotation in context.

groups.description: An array of Group IDs or the literal string `$rpc:requestGroups`

string.description: The URL to an image for the annotation service. This image will appear to the left of the name of the currently selected group.

arrayOf.description:
Alternative annotation services which the client should 
connect to instead of connecting to the public Hypothesis 
service at hypothes.is.

string.description: Secondary color for elements of the commenting UI.
The main background color of the commenting UI.
The background color for call to action buttons.
The font family for selection text in the annotation card.
The font family for the actual annotation value that the user writes about the page or selection.

object.description: Settings to adjust the commenting sidebar's look and feel.

string.description: A CSS selector specifying the containing element into which the sidebar iframe will be placed.
The username of the user to focus on.
The userid of the user to focus on.
The display name of the user to focus on.

focus.description: Defines a focused filter set for the available annotations on a page.

string.description: Host url and port number of receiving iframe

number.description: Number of nested iframes deep the client is relative from the receiving iframe.

string.description: The root URL from which assets are loaded.
The URL for the sidebar application which displays annotations.

description.short: The title of the page
description.long:
The title of the page. Note that by default Quarto will automatically 
use the title metadata from the page. Specify this field if you’d like 
to override the title for this provider.

description.short: A short description of the content.
description.long:
A short description of the content. Note that by default Quarto will
automatically  use the description metadata from the page. Specify this
field if you’d like to override the description for this provider.

description.short: The path to a preview image for the content.
description.long:
The path to a preview image for the content. By default, Quarto will use
the `image` value from the format metadata. If you provide an 
image, you may also optionally provide an `image-width` and `image-height`.

description.short: The alt text for the preview image.
description.long:
The alt text for the preview image. By default, Quarto will use
the `image-alt` value from the format metadata. If you provide an 
image, you may also optionally provide an `image-width` and `image-height`.

number.description: Port to listen on (defaults to random value between 3000 and 8000)

string.description: Hostname to bind to (defaults to 127.0.0.1)

serve.description: Use an exernal application to preview the project.

boolean.description: Open a web browser to view the preview (defaults to true)
Re-render input files when they change (defaults to true)
Navigate the browser automatically when outputs are updated (defaults to true)

number.description: Time (in seconds) after which to exit if there are no active clients

string.description:
Serve project preview using the specified command.
Interpolate the `--port` into the command using `{port}`.
Additional command line arguments for preview command.

object.description: Environment variables to set for preview command.

string.description: Regular expression for detecting when the server is ready.
Unique identifier for site
Published URL for site

description.short: Card style
description.long:
Card style (`summary` or `summary_large_image`).

If this is not provided, the best style will automatically
selected based upon other metadata. You can learn more about Twitter Card
styles [here](https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-for-websites/cards/overview/abouts-cards).

string.description: `@username` of the content creator (must be a quoted string)
`@username` of the website (must be a quoted string)
Locale of open graph metadata

description.short: Name that should be displayed for the overall site
description.long:
Name that should be displayed for the overall site. If not explicitly 
provided in the `open-graph` metadata, Quarto will use the website or
book `title` by default.

border.description: Footer border (`true`, `false`, or a border color)

string.description: Website title
Website description
The path to the favicon for this website
Base URL for published website
Path to site (defaults to `/`). Not required if you specify `site-url`.
Base URL for website source code repository
Subdirectory of repository containing website
Branch of website source code (defaults to `main`)
URL to use for the 'report an issue' repository action.

description.short: Links to source repository actions
description.long: Links to source repository actions (`none` or one or more of `edit`, `source`, `issue`)

boolean.description: Displays a 'reader-mode' tool which allows users to hide the sidebar and table of contents when viewing a page.

tracking-id.description: The Google tracking Id or measurement Id of this website.

description.short: Storage options for Google Analytics data
description.long:
Storage option for Google Analytics data using on of these two values:

`cookies`: Use cookies to store unique user and session identification (default).

`none`: Do not use cookies to store unique user and session identification.

For more about choosing storage options see [Storage](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-tools.html#storage).

description.short: Anonymize the user ip address.
description.long:
Anonymize the user ip address. For more about this feature, see 
[IP Anonymization (or IP masking) in Google Analytics](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2763052?hl=en).

description.short: The version number of Google Analytics to use.
description.long:
The version number of Google Analytics to use. 

- `3`: Use analytics.js
- `4`: use gtag. 

This is automatically detected based upon the `tracking-id`, but you may specify it.

google-analytics.description: Enable Google Analytics for this website

description.short: The type of consent that should be requested
description.long:
The type of consent that should be requested, using one of these two values:

- `implied` (default): This will notify the user that the site uses cookies and permit them to change preferences, but not block cookies unless the user changes their preferences.

- `express`: This will block cookies until the user expressly agrees to allow them (or continue blocking them if the user doesn’t agree).

description.short: The style of the consent banner that is displayed
description.long:
The style of the consent banner that is displayed:

- `simple` (default): A simple dialog in the lower right corner of the website.

- `headline`: A full width banner across the top of the website.

- `interstitial`: An semi-transparent overlay of the entire website.

- `standalone`: An opaque overlay of the entire website.

palette.description: Whether to use a dark or light appearance for the consent banner (`light` or `dark`).

policy-url.description: The url to the website’s cookie or privacy policy.

description.short: The text to display for the cookie preferences link in the website footer.
Request cookie consent before enabling scripts that set cookies
description.long:
Quarto includes the ability to request cookie consent before enabling scripts that set cookies, using [Cookie Consent](https://www.cookieconsent.com/).

The user’s cookie preferences will automatically control Google Analytics (if enabled) and can be used to control custom scripts you add as well. For more information see [Custom Scripts and Cookie Consent](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-tools.html#custom-scripts-and-cookie-consent).

limit.description: Number of matches to display (defaults to 20)

collapse-after.description: Matches after which to collapse additional results

copy-button.description: Provide button for copying search link

index-name.description: The name of the index to use when performing a search

application-id.description: The unique ID used by Algolia to identify your application

search-only-api-key.description: The Search-Only API key to use to connect to Algolia

boolean.description: Enable tracking of Algolia analytics events
Enable the display of the Algolia logo in the search results footer.

href.description: Field that contains the URL of index entries

title.description: Field that contains the title of index entries

text.description: Field that contains the text of index entries

section.description: Field that contains the section of index entries

object.description: Additional parameters to pass when executing a search

search.description: Provide full text search for website

title.description: The navbar title. Uses the project title if none is specified.

path.description: Path to a logo image that will be displayed to the left of the title.

string.description: Alternate text for the logo image.
Target href from navbar logo / title. By default, the logo and title link to the root page of the site (/index.html).

background.description: The navbar's background color (named or hex color).

foreground.description: The navbar's foreground color (named or hex color).

boolean.description: Include a search box in the navbar.
Always show the navbar (keeping it pinned).
Collapse the navbar into a menu when the display becomes narrow.

collapse-below.description: The responsive breakpoint below which the navbar will collapse into a menu (`sm`, `md`, `lg` (default), `xl`, `xxl`).

left.description: List of items for the left side of the navbar.

right.description: List of items for the right side of the navbar.

string.description: The identifier for this sidebar.

title.description: The sidebar title. Uses the project title if none is specified.

path.description: Path to a logo image that will be displayed in the sidebar.

boolean.description: Include a search control in the sidebar.

contents.description: List of items for the sidebar

background.description: The sidebar's background color (named or hex color).

foreground.description: The sidebar's foreground color (named or hex color).

boolean.description: Whether to show a border on the sidebar (defaults to true for 'docked' sidebars)

alignment.description: Alignment of the items within the sidebar (`left`, `right`, or `center`)

number.description: The depth at which the sidebar contents should be collapsed by default.

boolean.description: When collapsed, pin the collapsed sidebar to the top of the page.

header.description: Markdown to place above sidebar content (text or file path)

footer.description: Markdown to place below sidebar content (text or file path)

string.description: Markdown to insert at the beginning of each page’s body (below the title and author block).
Markdown to insert below each page’s body.

margin-header.description: Markdown to place above margin content (text or file path)

margin-footer.description: Markdown to place below margin content (text or file path)

boolean.description: Provide next and previous article links in footer
Provide a 'back to top' navigation button

string.description: Book title
Book subtitle

maybeArrayOf.description: Author or authors of the book

string.description: Book publication date
Format string for dates in the book
Book abstract
Description metadata for HTML version of book

path.description: Base name for single-file output (e.g. PDF, ePub)
Cover image (used in HTML and ePub formats)

string.description: Alternative text for cover image (used in HTML format)

maybeArrayOf.description:
Sharing buttons to include on navbar or sidebar
(one or more of `twitter`, `facebook`, `linkedin`)

Download buttons for other formats to include on navbar or sidebar
(one or more of `pdf`, `epub`, and `docx`)

arrayOf.description: Custom tools for navbar or sidebar

string.description: The Digital Object Identifier for this book.
Part title or path to input file

description.short: The role of this creator or contributor.
description.long:
The role of this creator or contributor using 
[MARC relators](https://loc.gov/marc/relators/relaterm.html). Human readable
translations to commonly used relators (e.g. 'author', 'editor') will 
attempt to be automatically translated.

string.description: An alternate version of the creator or contributor text used for alphabatizing.
The text describing the creator or contributor (for example, creator name).

object.errorDescription: be a format language description object

description.short: The target id for the about page.
description.long:
The target id of this about page. When the about page is rendered, it will 
place read the contents of a `div` with this id into the about template that you 
have selected (and replace the contents with the rendered about content).

If no such `div` is defined on the page, a `div` with this id will be created 
and appended to the end of the page.

description.short: The template to use to layout this about page.
description.long:
The template to use to layout this about page. Choose from:

- `jolla`
- `trestles`
- `solana`
- `marquee`
- `broadside`

description.short: The path to the main image on the about page.
description.long:
The path to the main image on the about page. If not specified, 
the `image` provided for the document itself will be used.

description.short: A valid CSS width for the about page image.
description.long: A valid CSS width for the about page image.

description.short: The shape of the image on the about page.
description.long:
The shape of the image on the about page.

- `rectangle`
- `round`
- `rounded`

description.short: The id of this listing.
description.long:
The id of this listing. When the listing is rendered, it will 
place the contents into a `div` with this id. If no such `div` is defined on the 
page, a `div` with this id will be created and appended to the end of the page.

In no `id` is provided for a listing, Quarto will synthesize one when rendering the page.

description.short: The type of listing to create.
description.long:
The type of listing to create. Choose one of:

- `default`: A blog style list of items
- `table`: A table of items
- `grid`: A grid of item cards
- `custom`: A custom template, provided by the `template` field

contents.description: The files or path globs of Quarto documents or YAML files that should be included in the listing.

description.short: Sort items in the listing by these fields.
description.long:
Sort items in the listing by these fields. The sort key is made up of a 
field name followed by a direction `asc` or `desc`.

For example:
`date asc`

Use `sort:false` to use the unsorted original order of items.

number.description: The maximum number of items to include in this listing.
The number of items to display on a page.

description.short: Shows or hides the sorting control for the listing.
description.long:
Shows or hides the sorting control for the listing. To control the 
fields that will be displayed in the sorting control, provide a list
of field names.

description.short: Shows or hides the filtering control for the listing.
description.long:
Shows or hides the filtering control for the listing. To control the 
fields that will be used to filter the listing, provide a list
of field names. By default all fields of the listing will be used
when filtering.

description.short: Display item categories from this listing in the margin of the page.
description.long:
Display item categories from this listing in the margin of the page.

  - `numbered`: Category list with number of items
  - `unnumbered`: Category list
  - `cloud`: Word cloud style categories

number.description: The number of items to include in your feed. Defaults to 20.

description.short: Whether to include full or partial content in the feed.
description.long:
Whether to include full or partial content in the feed.

- `full` (default): Include the complete content of the document in the feed.
- `partial`: Include only the first paragraph of the document in the feed.

description.short: The title for this feed.
description.long: The title for this feed. Defaults to the site title provided the Quarto project.

description.short: The path to an image for this feed.
description.long:
The path to an image for this feed. If not specified, the image for the page the listing 
appears on will be used, otherwise an image will be used if specified for the site 
in the Quarto project.

description.short: The description of this feed.
description.long:
The description of this feed. If not specified, the description for the page the 
listing appears on will be used, otherwise the description 
of the site will be used if specified in the Quarto project.

description.short: The language of the feed.
description.long:
The language of the feed. Omitted if not specified. 
See [https://www.rssboard.org/rss-language-codes](https://www.rssboard.org/rss-language-codes)
for a list of valid language codes.

string.description: A list of categories for which to create separate RSS feeds containing only posts with that category.

feed.description: Enables an RSS feed for the listing.

description.short: The date format to use when displaying dates (e.g. d-M-yyy).
description.long:
The date format to use when displaying dates (e.g. d-M-yyy). 
Learn more about supported date formatting values [here](https://deno.land/std@0.125.0/datetime).

description.short: The maximum length (in characters) of the description displayed in the listing.
description.long:
The maximum length (in characters) of the description displayed in the listing.
Defaults to 175.

string.description: The default image to use if an item in the listing doesn't have an image.

image-align.description: In `default` type listings, whether to place the image on the right or left side of the post content (`left` or `right`).

description.short: The height of the image being displayed.
description.long:
The height of the image being displayed (a CSS height string).

The width is automatically determined and the image will fill the rectangle without scaling (cropped to fill).

description.short: In `grid` type listings, the number of columns in the grid display.
description.long:
In grid type listings, the number of columns in the grid display.
Defaults to 3.

description.short: In `grid` type listings, whether to display a border around the item card.
description.long: In grid type listings, whether to display a border around the item card. Defaults to `true`.

description.short: In `grid` type listings, the alignment of the content within the card.
description.long: In grid type listings, the alignment of the content within the card (`left` (default), `right`, or `center`).

description.short: In `table` type listings, display the table rows with alternating background colors.
description.long:
In table type listings, display the table rows with alternating background colors.
Defaults to `false`.

description.short: In `table` type listings, highlight rows of the table when the user hovers the mouse over them.
description.long:
In table type listings, highlight rows of the table when the user hovers the mouse over them.
Defaults to false.

description.short: The path to a custom listing template.
description.long: The path to a custom listing template.

template-params.description: Parameters that are passed to the custom template.

description.short: The list of fields to include in this listing
description.long: The list of fields to include in this listing.

description.short: A mapping of display names for listing fields.
description.long:
A mapping that provides display names for specific fields. For example, to display the title column as ‘Report’ in a table listing you would write:

```yaml
listing:
  field-display-names:
  title: "Report"
```

description.short: Provides the date type for the field of a listing item.
description.long:
Provides the date type for the field of a listing item. Unknown fields are treated
as strings unless a type is provided. Valid types are `date`, `number`.

description.short: This list of fields to display as links in a table listing.
description.long:
The list of fields to display as hyperlinks to the source document 
when the listing type is a table. By default, only the `title` or 
`filename` is displayed as a link.

description.short: Fields that items in this listing must have populated.
description.long:
Fields that items in this listing must have populated.
If a listing is rendered and one more items in this listing 
is missing a required field, an error will occur and the render will.

include.description: Items with matching field values will be included in the listing.

exclude.description: Items with matching field values will be excluded from the listing.

string.description: The family name.
The given name.
A url to the abstract for this item.

accessed.description: Date the item has been accessed.

description.short: Short markup, decoration, or annotation to the item (e.g., to indicate items included in a review).
description.long:
Short markup, decoration, or annotation to the item (e.g., to indicate items included in a review);

For descriptive text (e.g., in an annotated bibliography), use `note` instead

string.description: Archive storing the item
Collection the item is part of within an archive.
Storage location within an archive (e.g. a box and folder number).
Geographic location of the archive.
Issuing or judicial authority (e.g. "USPTO" for a patent, "Fairfax Circuit Court" for a legal case).

description.short: Date the item was initially available
description.long:
Date the item was initially available (e.g. the online publication date of a journal 
article before its formal publication date; the date a treaty was made available for signing).

string.description: Call number (to locate the item in a library).

chair.description: The person leading the session containing a presentation (e.g. the organizer of the `container-title` of a `speech`).

chapter-number.description: Chapter number (e.g. chapter number in a book; track number on an album).

description.short: Identifier of the item in the input data file (analogous to BiTeX entrykey).
Label identifying the item in in-text citations of label styles (e.g. "Ferr78").

schema.description: Index (starting at 1) of the cited reference in the bibliography (generated by the CSL processor).

collection-editor.description: Editor of the collection holding the item (e.g. the series editor for a book).

collection-number.description: Number identifying the collection holding the item (e.g. the series number for a book)

string.description: Title of the collection holding the item (e.g. the series title for a book; the lecture series title for a presentation).

compiler.description: Person compiling or selecting material for an item from the works of various persons or bodies (e.g. for an anthology).

container-author.description: Author of the container holding the item (e.g. the book author for a book chapter).

description.short: Title of the container holding the item.

string.description: Short/abbreviated form of container-title;

contributor.description: A minor contributor to the item; typically cited using “with” before the name when listed in a bibliography.

curator.description: Curator of an exhibit or collection (e.g. in a museum).

string.description: Physical (e.g. size) or temporal (e.g. running time) dimensions of the item.
Minor subdivision of a court with a `jurisdiction` for a legal item

edition.description: (Container) edition holding the item (e.g. "3" when citing a chapter in the third edition of a book).

editorial-director.description: Managing editor ("Directeur de la Publication" in French).

description.short: Combined editor and translator of a work.
description.long:
Combined editor and translator of a work.

The citation processory must be automatically generate if editor and translator variables 
are identical; May also be provided directly in item data.

event-date.description: Date the event related to an item took place.

string.description: Name of the event related to the item (e.g. the conference name when citing a conference paper; the meeting where presentation was made).
Geographic location of the event related to the item (e.g. "Amsterdam, The Netherlands").

executive-producer.description: Executive producer of the item (e.g. of a television series).

description.short: Number of a preceding note containing the first reference to the item.
description.long:
Number of a preceding note containing the first reference to the item

Assigned by the CSL processor; Empty in non-note-based styles or when the item hasn't 
been cited in any preceding notes in a document

string.description: A url to the full text for this item.

description.short: Type, class, or subtype of the item
description.long:
Type, class, or subtype of the item (e.g. "Doctoral dissertation" for a PhD thesis; "NIH Publication" for an NIH technical report);

Do not use for topical descriptions or categories (e.g. "adventure" for an adventure movie)

guest.description: Guest (e.g. on a TV show or podcast).

host.description: Host of the item (e.g. of a TV show or podcast).

illustrator.description: Illustrator (e.g. of a children’s book or graphic novel).

string.description: International Standard Book Number (e.g. "978-3-8474-1017-1").
International Standard Serial Number.

description.short: Issue number of the item or container holding the item

string.description: Geographic scope of relevance (e.g. "US" for a US patent; the court hearing a legal case).
Keyword(s) or tag(s) attached to the item.

description.short: The language of the item (used only for citation of the item).
description.long:
The language of the item (used only for citation of the item).

Should be entered as an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code (e.g. "en", "zh"), 
optionally with a two-letter locale code (e.g. "de-DE", "de-AT").

This does not change the language of the item, instead it documents 
what language the item uses (which may be used in citing the item).

description.short: The license information applicable to an item.
A cite-specific pinpointer within the item.
description.long:
A cite-specific pinpointer within the item (e.g. a page number within a book, 
or a volume in a multi-volume work).

Must be accompanied in the input data by a label indicating the locator type 
(see the Locators term list).

string.description: Description of the item’s format or medium (e.g. "CD", "DVD", "Album", etc.)
Descriptive text or notes about an item (e.g. in an annotated bibliography).

number.description: Number identifying the item (e.g. a report number).

number-of-pages.description: Total number of pages of the cited item.

number-of-volumes.description: Total number of volumes, used when citing multi-volume books and such.

organizer.description: Organizer of an event (e.g. organizer of a workshop or conference).

description.short: The original creator of a work.
description.long:
The original creator of a work (e.g. the form of the author name 
listed on the original version of a book; the historical author of a work; 
the original songwriter or performer for a musical piece; the original 
developer or programmer for a piece of software; the original author of an 
adapted work such as a book adapted into a screenplay)

original-date.description: Issue date of the original version.

string.description: Original publisher, for items that have been republished by a different publisher.
Geographic location of the original publisher (e.g. "London, UK").
Title of the original version (e.g. "Война и мир", the untranslated Russian title of "War and Peace").

page.description: Range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue).

page-first.description: First page of the range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue).

page-last.description: Last page of the range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue).

description.short: Number of the specific part of the item being cited (e.g. part 2 of a journal article).
description.long:
Number of the specific part of the item being cited (e.g. part 2 of a journal article).

Use `part-title` for the title of the part, if any.

string.description: Title of the specific part of an item being cited.
A url to the pdf for this item.

performer.description: Performer of an item (e.g. an actor appearing in a film; a muscian performing a piece of music).

string.description: PubMed Central reference number.
PubMed reference number.

printing-number.description: Printing number of the item or container holding the item.

producer.description: Producer (e.g. of a television or radio broadcast).

string.description: A public url for this item.
The publisher of the item.
The geographic location of the publisher.

reviewed-author.description: Author of the item reviewed by the current item.

string.description: Type of the item being reviewed by the current item (e.g. book, film).
Title of the item reviewed by the current item.
Scale of e.g. a map or model.

script-writer.description: Writer of a script or screenplay (e.g. of a film).

section.description: Section of the item or container holding the item (e.g. "§2.0.1" for a law; "politics" for a newspaper article).

series-creator.description: Creator of a series (e.g. of a television series).

string.description: Source from whence the item originates (e.g. a library catalog or database).
Publication status of the item (e.g. "forthcoming"; "in press"; "advance online publication"; "retracted")

submitted.description: Date the item (e.g. a manuscript) was submitted for publication.

supplement-number.description: Supplement number of the item or container holding the item (e.g. for secondary legal items that are regularly updated between editions).

string.description: Short/abbreviated form of`title`.
Uniform Resource Locator (e.g. "https://aem.asm.org/cgi/content/full/74/9/2766")

version.description: Version of the item (e.g. "2.0.9" for a software program).

description.short: Volume number of the item (e.g. “2” when citing volume 2 of a book) or the container holding the item.
description.long:
Volume number of the item (e.g. "2" when citing volume 2 of a book) or the container holding the 
item (e.g. "2" when citing a chapter from volume 2 of a book).

Use `volume-title` for the title of the volume, if any.

description.short: Title of the volume of the item or container holding the item.
description.long:
Title of the volume of the item or container holding the item.

Also use for titles of periodical special issues, special sections, and the like.

string.description: Disambiguating year suffix in author-date styles (e.g. "a" in "Doe, 1999a").
Abstract of the item (e.g. the abstract of a journal article)
Digital Object Identifier (e.g. "10.1128/AEM.02591-07")

description.short: Resources related to the procedural history of a legal case or legislation.
description.long:
Resources related to the procedural history of a legal case or legislation;

Can also be used to refer to the procedural history of other items (e.g. 
"Conference canceled" for a presentation accepted as a conference that was subsequently 
canceled; details of a retraction or correction notice)

string.description: The primary title of the item.
The type of identifier
The value for the identifier

article-id.description: The unique identifier for this article.

string.description: Bibliographic identifier for a document that does not have traditional printed page numbers.
Electronic International Standard Serial Number.
Print International Standard Serial Number.
Generic article accession identifier.
The location of the publisher of this item.
The name of a subject or topic describing the article.
A list of subjects or topics describing the article.
The type of identifier (e.g. `nlm-ta` or `pmc`).
The value for the identifier

description.short: External identifier of a publication or journal.
description.long:
External identifier, typically assigned to a journal by 
a publisher, archive, or library to provide a unique identifier for 
the journal or publication.

string.description: The type used for the JATS `article` tag.
Textual content to add to includes
Name of file with content to add to includes

schema/definitions.yml.description: Version number according to Semantic Versioning

default.description: Default profile to apply if QUARTO_PROFILE is not defined.

group.description: Define a profile group for which at least one profile is always active.

schema/definitions.yml.description: Specify a default profile and profile groups

string.description: The path to the locally referenced notebook.

title.description: The title of the notebook when viewed.

string.description: The url to use when viewing this notebook.

path.description: The input document that will serve as the root document for this manuscript

string.description: The deployed url for this manuscript

meca-archive.description: Whether to generate a MECA bundle for this manuscript

maybeArrayOf.description: Additional file resources to be copied to output directory

description.short: Specifies that the page is an 'about' page and which template to use when laying out the page.
description.long:
Specifies that the page is an 'about' page and which template to use when laying out the page.

The allowed values are either:

- one of the possible template values (`jolla`, `trestles`, `solana`, `marquee`, or `broadside`))
- an object describing the 'about' page in more detail. See [About Pages](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-about.html) for more.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: subtitle
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: Identifies the subtitle of the document.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: author
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: Author or authors of the document

description.short: The list of organizations with which contributors are affiliated.
description.long:
The list of organizations with which contributors are
affiliated. Each institution is added as an [`<aff>`] element to
the author's contrib-group. See the Pandoc [JATS documentation](https://pandoc.org/jats.html) 
for details on `affiliation` fields.

description.short: Licensing and copyright information.
description.long:
Licensing and copyright information. This information is
rendered via the [`<permissions>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/permissions.html) element.
The variables `type`, `link`, and `text` should always be used
together. See the Pandoc [JATS documentation](https://pandoc.org/jats.html)
for details on `copyright` fields.

description.short: Information concerning the article that identifies or describes it.
description.long:
Information concerning the article that identifies or describes
it. The key-value pairs within this map are typically used
within the [`<article-meta>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/article-meta.html) element.
See the Pandoc [JATS documentation](https://pandoc.org/jats.html) for details on `article` fields.

description.short: Information on the journal in which the article is published.
description.long:
Information on the journal in which the article is published.
See the Pandoc [JATS documentation](https://pandoc.org/jats.html) for details on `journal` fields.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: abstract-title
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: Title used to label document abstract

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: notes
schema/document-attributes.yml.description:
Additional notes concerning the whole article. Added to the
article's frontmatter via the [`<notes>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/notes.html) element.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: tags
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: List of keywords. Items are used as contents of the [`<kwd>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/kwd.html) element; the elements are grouped in a [`<kwd-group>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/kwd-group.html) with the [`kwd-group-type`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/attribute/kwd-group-type.html) value `author`.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: doi
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: Displays the document Digital Object Identifier in the header.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: thanks
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: The contents of an acknowledgments footnote after the document title.

schema/document-attributes.yml.name: order
schema/document-attributes.yml.description: Order for document when included in a website automatic sidebar menu.

description.short: Citation information for the document itself.
description.long:
Citation information for the document itself specified as [CSL](https://docs.citationstyles.org/en/stable/specification.html) 
YAML in the document front matter.

For more on supported options, see [Citation Metadata](https://quarto.org/docs/reference/metadata/citation.html).

description.short: Enable a code copy icon for code blocks.
description.long:
Enable a code copy icon for code blocks. 

- `true`: Always show the icon
- `false`: Never show the icon
- `hover` (default): Show the icon when the mouse hovers over the code block

description.short:
Enables hyper-linking of functions within code blocks 
to their online documentation.
description.long:
Enables hyper-linking of functions within code blocks 
to their online documentation.

Code linking is currently implemented only for the knitr engine 
(via the [downlit](https://downlit.r-lib.org/) package).

description.short: The style to use when displaying code annotations
description.long:
The style to use when displaying code annotations. Set this value
to false to hide code annotations.

description.short: Include a code tools menu (for hiding and showing code).
description.long:
Include a code tools menu (for hiding and showing code).
Use `true` or `false` to enable or disable the standard code 
tools menu. Specify sub-properties `source`, `toggle`, and
`caption` to customize the behavior and appearance of code tools.

description.short: Show a thick left border on code blocks.
description.long:
Specifies to apply a left border on code blocks. Provide a hex color to specify that the border is
enabled as well as the color of the border.=

description.short: Show a background color for code blocks.
description.long:
Specifies to apply a background color on code blocks. Provide a hex color to specify that the background color is
enabled as well as the color of the background.

description.short: Specifies the coloring style to be used in highlighted source code.
description.long:
Specifies the coloring style to be used in highlighted source code.

Instead of a *STYLE* name, a JSON file with extension
` .theme` may be supplied.  This will be parsed as a KDE
syntax highlighting theme and (if valid) used as the
highlighting style.

description.short: Use the listings package for LaTeX code blocks.
description.long:
Use the `listings` package for LaTeX code blocks. The package
does not support multi-byte encoding for source code. To handle UTF-8
you would need to use a custom template. This issue is fully
documented here: [Encoding issue with the listings package](https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/LaTeX/Source_Code_Listings#Encoding_issue)

schema/document-code.yml.name: indented-code-classes
schema/document-code.yml.description: Specify classes to use for all indented code blocks

description.short: Sets the color of hyperlinks in the document.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the CSS `color` property on all links.

For LaTeX output, The color used for internal links using color options

description.short:
Look in the specified XML file for metadata for the EPUB.
The file should contain a series of [Dublin Core elements](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dces/).
description.long:
Look in the specified XML file for metadata for the EPUB.
The file should contain a series of [Dublin Core elements](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dces/).
For example:

```xml
<dc:rights>Creative Commons</dc:rights>
<dc:language>es-AR</dc:language>
```

By default, pandoc will include the following metadata elements:
`<dc:title>` (from the document title), `<dc:creator>` (from the
document authors), `<dc:date>` (from the document date, which should
be in [ISO 8601 format]), `<dc:language>` (from the `lang`
variable, or, if is not set, the locale), and `<dc:identifier
id="BookId">` (a randomly generated UUID). Any of these may be
overridden by elements in the metadata file.

Note: if the source document is Markdown, a YAML metadata block
in the document can be used instead.

schema/document-epub.yml.name: epub-subdirectory
schema/document-epub.yml.description:
Specify the subdirectory in the OCF container that is to hold the
EPUB-specific contents. The default is `EPUB`. To put the EPUB 
contents in the top level, use an empty string.

description.short: Embed the specified fonts in the EPUB

Specify the heading level at which to split the EPUB into separate
chapter files.
description.long:
Specify the heading level at which to split the EPUB into separate
chapter files. The default is to split into chapters at level-1
headings. This option only affects the internal composition of the
EPUB, not the way chapters and sections are displayed to users. Some
readers may be slow if the chapter files are too large, so for large
documents with few level-1 headings, one might want to use a chapter
level of 2 or 3.

schema/document-epub.yml.name: epub-cover-image
schema/document-epub.yml.description:
Use the specified image as the EPUB cover. It is recommended
that the image be less than 1000px in width and height.

schema/document-epub.yml.name: epub-title-page
schema/document-epub.yml.description: If false, disables the generation of a title page.

schema/document-execute.yml.name: engine
schema/document-execute.yml.description: Engine used for executable code blocks.

string.description: The name to display in the UI.
The name of the language the kernel implements.
The name of the kernel.

description.short: Cache results of computations.
description.long:
Cache results of computations (using the [knitr cache](https://yihui.org/knitr/demo/cache/) 
for R documents, and [Jupyter Cache](https://jupyter-cache.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) 
for Jupyter documents).

Note that cache invalidation is triggered by changes in chunk source code 
(or other cache attributes you've defined). 

- `true`: Cache results
- `false`: Do not cache results
- `refresh`: Force a refresh of the cache even if has not been otherwise invalidated.

description.short: Re-use previous computational output when rendering
description.long:
Control the re-use of previous computational output when rendering.

- `true`: Never recompute previously generated computational output during a global project render
- `false` (default): Recompute previously generated computational output
- `auto`: Re-compute previously generated computational output only in case their source file changes

ojs-export.description: OJS variables to export to server.

ojs-import.description: Server reactive values to import into OJS.

description.short: Run Jupyter kernels within a peristent daemon (to mitigate kernel startup time).
description.long:
Run Jupyter kernels within a peristent daemon (to mitigate kernel startup time).
By default a daemon with a timeout of 300 seconds will be used. Set `daemon`
to another timeout value or to `false` to disable it altogether.

description.short: The aspect ratio of the plot, i.e., the ratio of height/width.
description.long:
The aspect ratio of the plot, i.e., the ratio of height/width. When `fig-asp` is specified,
the height of a plot (the option `fig-height`) is calculated from `fig-width * fig-asp`.

The `fig-asp` option is only available within the knitr engine.

description.short: Sets the main font for the document.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the CSS `font-family` on the HTML element.

For LaTeX output, the main font family for use with `xelatex` or 
`lualatex`. Takes the name of any system font, using the
[`fontspec`](https://ctan.org/pkg/fontspec) package. 

For ConTeXt output, the main font family. Use the name of any 
system font. See [ConTeXt Fonts](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Fonts) for more
information.

description.short: Sets the font used for when displaying code.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the CSS font-family property on code elements.

For PowerPoint output, sets the font used for code.

For LaTeX output, the monospace font family for use with `xelatex` or 
`lualatex`: take the name of any system font, using the
[`fontspec`](https://ctan.org/pkg/fontspec) package.  

For ConTeXt output, the monspace font family. Use the name of any 
system font. See [ConTeXt Fonts](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Fonts) for more
information.

description.short: Sets the main font size for the document.
description.long:

For LaTeX and ConTeXt output, sets the font size for the document body text.

description.short: Allows font encoding to be specified through `fontenc` package.
description.long:

See [LaTeX Font Encodings Guide](https://ctan.org/pkg/encguide) for addition information on font encoding.

description.short: Font package to use when compiling a PDF with the `pdflatex` `pdf-engine`.
description.long:
Font package to use when compiling a PDf with the `pdflatex` `pdf-engine`. 

See [The LaTeX Font Catalogue](https://tug.org/FontCatalogue/) for a 
summary of font options available.

For groff (`ms`) files, the font family for example, `T` or `P`.

description.short: Options for the package used as `fontfamily`.
description.long:
Options for the package used as `fontfamily`.

For example, to use the Libertine font with proportional lowercase
(old-style) figures through the [`libertinus`](https://ctan.org/pkg/libertinus) package:

```yaml
fontfamily: libertinus
fontfamilyoptions:
  - osf
  - p
```

description.short: The sans serif font family for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.
description.long:
The sans serif font family for use with `xelatex` or 
`lualatex`. Takes the name of any system font, using the
[`fontspec`](https://ctan.org/pkg/fontspec) package.

description.long:

description.short: The main font options for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.
description.long:

any options available through [`fontspec`](https://ctan.org/pkg/fontspec).

For example, to use the [TeX Gyre](http://www.gust.org.pl/projects/e-foundry/tex-gyre) 
version of Palatino with lowercase figures:

```yaml
mainfont: TeX Gyre Pagella
mainfontoptions:
  - Numbers=Lowercase
  - Numbers=Proportional    
```
