description.short:
Specify what to do with insertions, deletions, and comments produced by 
the MS Word “Track Changes” feature.
description.long:
Specify what to do with insertions, deletions, and comments
produced by the MS Word "Track Changes" feature.  

- `accept` (default): Process all insertions and deletions.
- `reject`: Ignore them.
- `all`: Include all insertions, deletions, and comments, wrapped
  in spans with `insertion`, `deletion`, `comment-start`, and
  `comment-end` classes, respectively. The author and time of
  change is included. 

Notes:

- Both `accept` and `reject` ignore comments.

- `all` is useful for scripting: only
  accepting changes from a certain reviewer, say, or before a
  certain date. If a paragraph is inserted or deleted,
  `track-changes: all` produces a span with the class
  `paragraph-insertion`/`paragraph-deletion` before the
  affected paragraph break. 

- This option only affects the docx reader.

description.short: Embed the input file source code in the generated HTML
description.long:
Embed the input file source code in the generated HTML. A hidden div with 
class `quarto-embedded-source-code` will be added to the document. This
option is not normally used directly but rather in the implementation
of the `code-tools` option.

schema/document-hidden.yml.name: keep-hidden
schema/document-hidden.yml.description: Keep hidden source code and output (marked with class `.hidden`)

description.short: Generate HTML output (if necessary) even when targeting markdown.
description.long:
Generate HTML output (if necessary) even when targeting markdown. Enables the 
embedding of more sophisticated output (e.g. Jupyter widgets) in markdown.

schema/document-hidden.yml.name: output-divs
schema/document-hidden.yml.description:
Indicates that computational output should not be written within divs. 
This is necessary for some formats (e.g. `pptx`) to properly layout
figures.

schema/document-hidden.yml.name: merge-includes
schema/document-hidden.yml.description:
Disable merging of string based and file based includes (some formats, 
specifically ePub, do not correctly handle this merging)

schema/document-includes.yml.name: header-includes
schema/document-includes.yml.description: Content to include at the end of the document header.

schema/document-includes.yml.name: include-before
schema/document-includes.yml.description: Content to include at the beginning of the document body (e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command in LaTeX).

schema/document-includes.yml.name: include-after
schema/document-includes.yml.description: Content to include at the end of the document body (before the `</body>` tag in HTML, or the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX).

schema/document-includes.yml.name: include-before-body
schema/document-includes.yml.description:
Include contents at the beginning of the document body
(e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command
in LaTeX).

A string value or an object with key "file" indicates a filename whose contents are to be included

An object with key "text" indicates textual content to be included

schema/document-includes.yml.name: include-after-body
schema/document-includes.yml.description:
Include content at the end of the document body immediately after the markdown content. While it will be included before the closing `</body>` tag in HTML and the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX, this option refers to the end of the markdown content.

A string value or an object with key "file" indicates a filename whose contents are to be included

An object with key "text" indicates textual content to be included

schema/document-includes.yml.name: include-in-header
schema/document-includes.yml.description:
Include contents at the end of the header. This can
be used, for example, to include special CSS or JavaScript in HTML
documents.

A string value or an object with key "file" indicates a filename whose contents are to be included

An object with key "text" indicates textual content to be included

schema/document-includes.yml.name: resources
schema/document-includes.yml.description: Path (or glob) to files to publish with this document.

description.short: Text to be in a running header.
description.long:
Text to be in a running header.

Provide a single option or up to four options for different placements
(odd page inner, odd page outer, even page innner, even page outer).

description.short: Text to be in a running footer.
description.long:
Text to be in a running footer.

Provide a single option or up to four options for different placements
(odd page inner, odd page outer, even page innner, even page outer).

See [ConTeXt Headers and Footers](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Headers_and_Footers) for more information.

schema/document-includes.yml.name: includesource
schema/document-includes.yml.description: Whether to include all source documents as file attachments in the PDF file.

description.short: Include file with YAML metadata
description.long:
Read metadata from the supplied YAML (or JSON) file. This
option can be used with every input format, but string scalars
in the YAML file will always be parsed as Markdown. Generally,
the input will be handled the same as in YAML metadata blocks.
Metadata values specified inside the document, or by using `-M`,
overwrite values specified with this option.

description.short: Include files with YAML metadata
description.long:
Read metadata from the supplied YAML (or JSON) files. This
option can be used with every input format, but string scalars
in the YAML file will always be parsed as Markdown. Generally,
the input will be handled the same as in YAML metadata blocks.
Values in files specified later in the list will be preferred
over those specified earlier. Metadata values specified inside
the document, or by using `-M`, overwrite values specified with
this option.

description.short: Identifies the main language of the document (e.g. `en` or `en-GB`).
description.long:
Identifies the main language of the document using IETF language tags 
(following the [BCP 47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/bcp47) standard), 
such as `en` or `en-GB`. The [Language subtag lookup](https://r12a.github.io/app-subtags/) 
tool can look up or verify these tags. 

This affects most formats, and controls hyphenation 
in PDF output when using LaTeX (through [`babel`](https://ctan.org/pkg/babel) 
and [`polyglossia`](https://ctan.org/pkg/polyglossia)) or ConTeXt.

schema/document-language.yml.name: language
schema/document-language.yml.description: YAML file containing custom language translations

description.short: The base script direction for the document (`rtl` or `ltr`).
description.long:
The base script direction for the document (`rtl` or `ltr`).

For bidirectional documents, native pandoc `span`s and
`div`s with the `dir` attribute can
be used to override the base direction in some output
formats.  This may not always be necessary if the final
renderer (e.g. the browser, when generating HTML) supports
the [Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm].

When using LaTeX for bidirectional documents, only the
`xelatex` engine is fully supported (use
`--pdf-engine=xelatex`).

description.short: Use Quarto's built-in PDF rendering wrapper
description.long:
Use Quarto's built-in PDF rendering wrapper (includes support 
for automatically installing missing LaTeX packages)

schema/document-latexmk.yml.name: latex-makeindex-opts
schema/document-latexmk.yml.description: Array of command line options for `makeindex`.

schema/document-latexmk.yml.name: latex-tlmgr-opts
schema/document-latexmk.yml.description: Array of command line options for `tlmgr`.

schema/document-latexmk.yml.name: latex-output-dir
schema/document-latexmk.yml.description: Output directory for intermediates and PDF.

schema/document-latexmk.yml.name: latex-tinytex
schema/document-latexmk.yml.description: Set to `false` to prevent an installation of TinyTex from being used to compile PDF documents.

schema/document-latexmk.yml.name: latex-input-paths
schema/document-latexmk.yml.description: Array of paths LaTeX should search for inputs.

description.short: Options for the document class,
description.long:
For LaTeX/PDF output, the options set for the document
class.

For HTML output using KaTeX, you can render display
math equations flush left using `classoption: fleqn`

schema/document-layout.yml.name: papersize
schema/document-layout.yml.description: The paper size for the document.

description.short: The options for margins and text layout for this document.
description.long:
The options for margins and text layout for this document.

See [ConTeXt Layout](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Layout) for additional information.

schema/document-layout.yml.name: page-layout
schema/document-layout.yml.description: The page layout to use for this document (`article`, `full`, or `custom`)

description.short: Target page width for output (used to compute columns widths for `layout` divs)
description.long:
Target page width for output (used to compute columns widths for `layout` divs).
Defaults to 6.5 inches, which corresponds to default letter page settings in 
docx and odt.

content-mode.description: Defines whether to use the standard, slim, or full content grid or to automatically select the most appropriate content grid.

string.description: The base width of the sidebar (left) column in an HTML page.
The base width of the margin (right) column in an HTML page.
The base width of the body (center) column in an HTML page.
The width of the gutter that appears between columns in an HTML page.

description.short: Properties of the grid system used to layout Quarto HTML pages.
The layout of the appendix for this document (`none`, `plain`, or `default`)
description.long:
The layout of the appendix for this document (`none`, `plain`, or `default`).

To completely disable any styling of the appendix, choose the appendix style `none`. For minimal styling, choose `plain.`

description.short: Controls the formats which are provided in the citation section of the appendix (`false`, `display`, or `bibtex`).
description.long:
Controls the formats which are provided in the citation section of the appendix.

Use `false` to disable the display of the 'cite as' appendix. Pass one or more of `display` or `bibtex` to enable that
format in 'cite as' appendix.

description.short: The layout of the title block for this document (`none`, `plain`, or `default`).
description.long:
The layout of the title block for this document (`none`, `plain`, or `default`).

To completely disable any styling of the title block, choose the style `none`. For minimal styling, choose `plain.`

description.short: Apply a banner style treatment to the title block.
description.long:
Applies a banner style treatment for the title block. You may specify one of the following values:

`true`
: Will enable the banner style display and automatically select a background color based upon the theme.

`<css color value>`
: If you provide a CSS color value, the banner will be enabled and the background color set to the provided CSS color.

`<path>`
: If you provide the path to a file, the banner will be enabled and the background image will be set to the file path.

See `title-block-banner-color` if you'd like to control the color of the title block banner text.

description.short: Sets the color of text elements in a banner style title block.
description.long:
Sets the color of text elements in a banner style title block. Use one of the following values:

`body` | `body-bg`
: Will set the text color to the body text color or body background color, respectively.

`<css color value>`
: If you provide a CSS color value, the text color will be set to the provided CSS color.

description.short: Enables or disables the display of categories in the title block.

schema/document-layout.yml.name: max-width
schema/document-layout.yml.description: Adds a css `max-width` to the body Element.

description.short: Sets the left margin of the document.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-left` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the left margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the left margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the left page margin.

description.short: Sets the right margin of the document.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-right` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the right margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the right margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the right page margin.

description.short: Sets the top margin of the document.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-top` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the top margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the top margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the top page margin.

description.short: Sets the bottom margin of the document.
description.long:
For HTML output, sets the `margin-bottom` property on the Body element.

For LaTeX output, sets the bottom margin if `geometry` is not 
used (otherwise `geometry` overrides this value)

For ConTeXt output, sets the bottom margin if `layout` is not used, 
otherwise `layout` overrides these.

For `wkhtmltopdf` sets the bottom page margin.

description.short: Options for the geometry package.
description.long:
Options for the [geometry](https://ctan.org/pkg/geometry) package. For example:

```yaml
geometry:
  - top=30mm
  - left=20mm
  - heightrounded
```

description.short: Additional non-color options for the hyperref package.
description.long:
Options for the [hyperref](https://ctan.org/pkg/hyperref) package. For example:

```yaml
hyperrefoptions:
  - linktoc=all
  - pdfwindowui
  - pdfpagemode=FullScreen      
```

To customize link colors, please see the [Quarto PDF reference](https://quarto.org/docs/reference/formats/pdf.html#colors).

description.short: Whether to use document class settings for indentation.
description.long:
Whether to use document class settings for indentation. If the document 
class settings are not used, the default LaTeX template removes indentation 
and adds space between paragraphs

For groff (`ms`) documents, the paragraph indent, for example, `2m`.

description.short: Make `\paragraph` and `\subparagraph` free-standing rather than run-in.
description.long:
Make `\paragraph` and `\subparagraph` (fourth- and
fifth-level headings, or fifth- and sixth-level with book
classes) free-standing rather than run-in; requires further
formatting to distinguish from `\subsubsection` (third- or
fourth-level headings). Instead of using this option,
[KOMA-Script](https://ctan.org/pkg/koma-script) can adjust headings 
more extensively:

```yaml
header-includes: |
  \RedeclareSectionCommand[
    beforeskip=-10pt plus -2pt minus -1pt,
    afterskip=1sp plus -1sp minus 1sp,
    font=\normalfont\itshape]{paragraph}
  \RedeclareSectionCommand[
    beforeskip=-10pt plus -2pt minus -1pt,
    afterskip=1sp plus -1sp minus 1sp,
    font=\normalfont\scshape,
    indent=0pt]{subparagraph}
```

schema/document-library.yml.name: s5-url
schema/document-library.yml.description: The base url for s5 presentations.

schema/document-library.yml.name: slidy-url
schema/document-library.yml.description: The base url for Slidy presentations.

schema/document-library.yml.name: slideous-url
schema/document-library.yml.description: The base url for Slideous presentations.

schema/document-links.yml.name: link-external-icon
schema/document-links.yml.description: Show a special icon next to links that leave the current site.

schema/document-links.yml.name: link-external-newwindow
schema/document-links.yml.description: Open external links in a new browser window or tab (rather than navigating the current tab).

description.short: A regular expression that can be used to determine whether a link is an internal link.
description.long:
A regular expression that can be used to determine whether a link is an internal link. For example, 
the following will treat links that start with http://www.quarto.org as internal links (and others
will be considered external):

```
^(?:http:|https:)\/\/www\.quarto\.org\/custom
```

string.description: The title for this alternative link.
The href for tihs alternative link.

description.short: Controls whether links to other rendered formats are displayed in HTML output.
description.long:
Controls whether links to other rendered formats are displayed in HTML output.

Pass `false` to disable the display of format lengths or pass a list of format names for which you'd
like links to be shown.

description.short: Controls the display of links to notebooks that provided embedded content or are created from documents.
description.long:
Controls the display of links to notebooks that provided embedded content or are created from documents.

Specify `false` to disable linking to source Notebooks. Specify `inline` to show links to source notebooks beneath the content they provide. 
Specify `global` to show a set of global links to source notebooks.

description.short: Controls whether referenced notebooks are embedded in JATS output as subarticles.
description.long:
Controls the display of links to notebooks that provided embedded content or are created from documents.

Defaults to `true` - specify `false` to disable embedding Notebook as subarticles with the JATS output.

schema/document-links.yml.name: notebook-view
schema/document-links.yml.description: Configures the HTML viewer for notebooks that provide embedded content.

schema/document-links.yml.name: notebook-view-style
schema/document-links.yml.description: The style of document to render. Setting this to `notebook` will create additional notebook style affordances.

schema/document-listing.yml.name: listing
schema/document-listing.yml.description: Automatically generate the contents of a page from a list of Quarto documents or other custom data.

theme.description: The mermaid built-in theme to use.

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: keywords
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: List of keywords to be included in the document metadata.

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: description
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: The document description. Some applications show this as `Comments` metadata.

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: copyright

string.description: The holder of the copyright.
The text to display for the license.

schema/document-metadata.yml.description: The copyright for this document, if any.

string.description: The type of the license.
A URL to the license.
The text to display for the license.

description.short: The License for this document, if any. (e.g. `CC BY`)
description.long:
The license for this document, if any. 

Creative Commons licenses `CC BY`, `CC BY-SA`, `CC BY-ND`, `CC BY-NC` will automatically generate a license link
in the document appendix. Other license text will be placed in the appendix verbatim.

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: title-meta
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: Sets the title metadata for the document

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: pagetitle
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: Sets the title metadata for the document

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: title-prefix
schema/document-metadata.yml.description:
Specify STRING as a prefix at the beginning of the title that appears in 
the HTML header (but not in the title as it appears at the beginning of the body)

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: description-meta
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: Sets the description metadata for the document

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: author-meta
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: Sets the author metadata for the document

schema/document-metadata.yml.name: date-meta
schema/document-metadata.yml.description: Sets the date metadata for the document

description.short: Number section headings
description.long:
Number section headings rendered output. By default, sections are not numbered.
Sections with class `.unnumbered` will never be numbered, even if `number-sections`
is specified.

description.short: The depth to which sections should be numbered.
description.long:
By default, all headings in your document create a 
numbered section. You customize numbering depth using 
the `number-depth` option. 

For example, to only number sections immediately below 
the chapter level, use this:

```yaml  
number-depth: 1
```

schema/document-numbering.yml.name: secnumdepth
schema/document-numbering.yml.description: The numbering depth for sections. (Use `number-depth` instead).

description.short: Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default)
description.long:
Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default)
The first number is added to the section number for
top-level headings, the second for second-level headings, and so on.
So, for example, if you want the first top-level heading in your
document to be numbered "6", specify `number-offset: 5`. If your
document starts with a level-2 heading which you want to be numbered
"1.5", specify `number-offset: [1,4]`. Implies `number-sections`

schema/document-numbering.yml.name: section-numbering
schema/document-numbering.yml.description: Schema to use for numbering sections, e.g. `1.A.1`

description.short:
Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer. For example, with 
`shift-heading-level-by: -1`, level 2 headings become level 1 headings.
description.long:
Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer.
For example, with `shift-heading-level-by: -1`, level 2
headings become level 1 headings, and level 3 headings
become level 2 headings.  Headings cannot have a level
less than 1, so a heading that would be shifted below level 1
becomes a regular paragraph.  Exception: with a shift of -N,
a level-N heading at the beginning of the document
replaces the metadata title.

description.short: Sets the page numbering style and location for the document.
description.long:
Sets the page numbering style and location for the document using the
`\setuppagenumbering` command. 

See [ConTeXt Page Numbering](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/Command/setuppagenumbering) 
for additional information.

description.short:
Treat top-level headings as the given division type (`default`, `section`, `chapter`, or `part`). The hierarchy
order is part, chapter, then section; all headings are shifted such 
that the top-level heading becomes the specified type.
description.long:
Treat top-level headings as the given division type (`default`, `section`, `chapter`, or `part`). The hierarchy
order is part, chapter, then section; all headings are shifted such 
that the top-level heading becomes the specified type.  

The default behavior is to determine the
best division type via heuristics: unless other conditions
apply, `section` is chosen. When the `documentclass`
variable is set to `report`, `book`, or `memoir` (unless the
`article` option is specified), `chapter` is implied as the
setting for this option. If `beamer` is the output format,
specifying either `chapter` or `part` will cause top-level
headings to become `\part{..}`, while second-level headings
remain as their default type.

schema/document-ojs.yml.name: ojs-engine
schema/document-ojs.yml.description:
If `true`, force the presence of the OJS runtime. If `false`, force the absence instead.
If unset, the OJS runtime is included only if OJS cells are present in the document.

schema/document-options.yml.name: reference-doc
schema/document-options.yml.description:
Use the specified file as a style reference in producing a docx, 
pptx, or odt file.

schema/document-options.yml.name: theme

string.description: The light theme name, theme scss file, or a mix of both.
The dark theme name, theme scss file, or a mix of both.

schema/document-options.yml.description: Theme name, theme scss file, or a mix of both.

schema/document-options.yml.name: minimal
schema/document-options.yml.description: Disables the built in html features like theming, anchor sections, code block behavior, and more.

schema/document-options.yml.name: document-css
schema/document-options.yml.description: Enables inclusion of Pandoc default CSS for this document.

schema/document-options.yml.name: css
schema/document-options.yml.description: One or more CSS style sheets.

schema/document-options.yml.name: anchor-sections
schema/document-options.yml.description: Enables hover over a section title to see an anchor link.

schema/document-options.yml.name: smooth-scroll
schema/document-options.yml.description: Enables smooth scrolling within the page.

description.short: Method use to render math in HTML output
description.long:
Method use to render math in HTML output (`plain`, `webtex`, `gladtex`, `mathml`, `mathjax`, `katex`).

See the Pandoc documentation on [Math Rendering in HTML](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#math-rendering-in-html)
for additional details.

schema/document-options.yml.name: section-divs
schema/document-options.yml.description:
Wrap sections in `<section>` tags and attach identifiers to the enclosing `<section>`
rather than the heading itself.

description.short: Specify a prefix to be added to all identifiers and internal links.
description.long:
Specify a prefix to be added to all identifiers and internal links in HTML and
DocBook output, and to footnote numbers in Markdown and Haddock output. 
This is useful for preventing duplicate identifiers when generating fragments
to be included in other pages.

description.short: Method for obfuscating mailto: links in HTML documents.
description.long:
Specify a method for obfuscating `mailto:` links in HTML documents.

- `javascript`: Obfuscate links using JavaScript.
- `references`: Obfuscate links by printing their letters as decimal or hexadecimal character references.
- `none` (default): Do not obfuscate links.

schema/document-options.yml.name: html-q-tags
schema/document-options.yml.description: Use `<q>` tags for quotes in HTML.

description.short: Use the specified engine when producing PDF output.
description.long:
Use the specified engine when producing PDF output. If the engine is not
in your PATH, the full path of the engine may be specified here. If this
option is not specified, Quarto uses the following defaults
depending on the output format in use:

- `latex`: `xelatex` (other options: `pdflatex`, `lualatex`,
  `tectonic`, `latexmk`)
- `context`: `context`
- `html`:  `wkhtmltopdf` (other options: `prince`, `weasyprint`;
  see [print-css.rocks](https://print-css.rocks) for a good
  introduction to PDF generation from HTML/CSS.)
- `ms`:  `pdfroff`

description.short: Use the given string as a command-line argument to the `pdf-engine`.
description.long:
Use the given string as a command-line argument to the pdf-engine.
For example, to use a persistent directory foo for latexmk’s auxiliary
files, use `pdf-engine-opt: -outdir=foo`. Note that no check for 
duplicate options is done.

schema/document-options.yml.name: beamerarticle
schema/document-options.yml.description: Whether to produce a Beamer article from this presentation.

schema/document-options.yml.name: beameroption
schema/document-options.yml.description: Add an extra Beamer option using `\setbeameroption{}`.

schema/document-options.yml.name: aspectratio
schema/document-options.yml.description: The aspect ratio for this presentation.

schema/document-options.yml.name: logo
schema/document-options.yml.description: The logo image for slides.

schema/document-options.yml.name: titlegraphic
schema/document-options.yml.description: The image for the title slide.

schema/document-options.yml.name: navigation
schema/document-options.yml.description: Controls navigation symbols for the presentation (`empty`, `frame`, `vertical`, or `horizontal`)

schema/document-options.yml.name: section-titles
schema/document-options.yml.description: Whether to enable title pages for new sections.

schema/document-options.yml.name: colortheme
schema/document-options.yml.description: The Beamer color theme for this presentation.

schema/document-options.yml.name: fonttheme
schema/document-options.yml.description: The Beamer font theme for this presentation.

schema/document-options.yml.name: innertheme
schema/document-options.yml.description: The Beamer inner theme for this presentation.

schema/document-options.yml.name: outertheme
schema/document-options.yml.description: The Beamer outer theme for this presentation.

schema/document-options.yml.name: themeoptions
schema/document-options.yml.description: Options passed to LaTeX Beamer themes.

schema/document-options.yml.name: section
schema/document-options.yml.description: The section number in man pages.

schema/document-options.yml.name: variant
schema/document-options.yml.description: Enable and disable extensions for markdown output (e.g. "+emoji")

schema/document-options.yml.name: markdown-headings
schema/document-options.yml.description:
Specify whether to use `atx` (`#`-prefixed) or
`setext` (underlined) headings for level 1 and 2
headings (`atx` or `setext`).

schema/document-options.yml.name: keep-yaml
schema/document-options.yml.description: Preserve the original YAML front matter in rendered markdown

description.short: Determines which ipynb cell output formats are rendered (`none`, `all`, or `best`).
description.long:
Determines which ipynb cell output formats are rendered.

- `all`: Preserve all of the data formats included in the original.
- `none`: Omit the contents of data cells.
- `best` (default): Instruct pandoc to try to pick the
  richest data block in each output cell that is compatible
  with the output format.

description.short: semver version range for required quarto version
description.long:
A semver version range describing the supported quarto versions for this document
or project.

Examples:

- `>= 1.1.0`: Require at least quarto version 1.1
- `1.*`: Require any quarto versions whose major version number is 1

description.short: The mode to use when previewing this document.
description.long:
The mode to use when previewing this document. To disable any special
previewing features, pass `raw` as the preview-mode.

description.short: Adds the necessary setup to the document preamble to generate PDF/A of the type specified.
description.long:
Adds the necessary setup to the document preamble to generate PDF/A of the type specified.

If the value is set to `true`, `1b:2005` will be used as default.

To successfully generate PDF/A the required
ICC color profiles have to be available and the content and all
included files (such as images) have to be standard conforming.
The ICC profiles and output intent may be specified using the
variables `pdfaiccprofile` and `pdfaintent`.  See also [ConTeXt
PDFA](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/PDF/A) for more details.

description.short:
When used in conjunction with `pdfa`, specifies the ICC profile to use 
in the PDF, e.g. `default.cmyk`.
description.long:
When used in conjunction with `pdfa`, specifies the ICC profile to use 
in the PDF, e.g. `default.cmyk`.

If left unspecified, `sRGB.icc` is used as default. May be repeated to 
include multiple profiles. Note that the profiles have to be available 
on the system. They can be obtained from 
[ConTeXt ICC Profiles](https://wiki.contextgarden.net/PDFX#ICC_profiles).

description.short: When used in conjunction with `pdfa`, specifies the output intent for the colors.
description.long:
When used in conjunction with `pdfa`, specifies the output intent for
the colors, for example `ISO coated v2 300\letterpercent\space (ECI)`

If left unspecified, `sRGB IEC61966-2.1` is used as default.

schema/document-references.yml.name: bibliography
schema/document-references.yml.description: Document bibliography (BibTeX or CSL). May be a single file or a list of files

schema/document-references.yml.name: csl
schema/document-references.yml.description: Citation Style Language file to use for formatting references.

schema/document-references.yml.name: citations-hover
schema/document-references.yml.description: Enables a hover popup for citation that shows the reference information.

schema/document-references.yml.name: citation-location
schema/document-references.yml.description: Where citation information should be displayed (`document` or `margin`)

schema/document-references.yml.name: cite-method
schema/document-references.yml.description: Method used to format citations (`citeproc`, `natbib`, or `biblatex`).

description.short: Turn on built-in citation processing
description.long:
Turn on built-in citation processing. To use this feature, you will need
to have a document containing citations and a source of bibliographic data: 
either an external bibliography file or a list of `references` in the 
document's YAML metadata. You can optionally also include a `csl` 
citation style file.

schema/document-references.yml.name: biblatexoptions
schema/document-references.yml.description: A list of options for BibLaTeX.

schema/document-references.yml.name: natbiboptions
schema/document-references.yml.description: One or more options to provide for `natbib` when generating a bibliography.

schema/document-references.yml.name: biblio-style
schema/document-references.yml.description: The bibliography style to use (e.g. `\bibliographystyle{dinat}`) when using `natbib` or `biblatex`.

schema/document-references.yml.name: biblio-title
schema/document-references.yml.description: The bibliography title to use when using `natbib` or `biblatex`.

schema/document-references.yml.name: biblio-config
schema/document-references.yml.description: Controls whether to output bibliography configuration for `natbib` or `biblatex` when cite method is not `citeproc`.

description.short: JSON file containing abbreviations of journals that should be used in formatted bibliographies.

schema/document-references.yml.name: link-citations
schema/document-references.yml.description: If true, citations will be hyperlinked to the corresponding bibliography entries (for author-date and numerical styles only). Defaults to false.

description.short: If true, DOIs, PMCIDs, PMID, and URLs in bibliographies will be rendered as hyperlinks.
description.long:
If true, DOIs, PMCIDs, PMID, and URLs in bibliographies will be rendered as hyperlinks. (If an entry contains a DOI, PMCID, PMID, or URL, but none of 
these fields are rendered by the style, then the title, or in the absence of a title the whole entry, will be hyperlinked.) Defaults to true.

description.short: Places footnote references or superscripted numerical citations after following punctuation.
description.long:
If true (the default for note styles), Quarto (via Pandoc) will put footnote references or superscripted numerical citations after 
following punctuation. For example, if the source contains blah blah [@jones99]., the result will look like blah blah.[^1], with 
the note moved after the period and the space collapsed. 

If false, the space will still be collapsed, but the footnote will not be moved after the punctuation. The option may also be used 
in numerical styles that use superscripts for citation numbers (but for these styles the default is not to move the citation).

description.short: Format to read from
description.long: Format to read from. Extensions can be individually enabled or disabled by appending +EXTENSION or -EXTENSION to the format name (e.g. markdown+emoji).

schema/document-render.yml.name: output-file
schema/document-render.yml.default: Input filename with output extension (e.g. .pdf, .html, etc.)

schema/document-render.yml.name: output-ext
schema/document-render.yml.description: Extension to use for generated output file

schema/document-render.yml.name: template
schema/document-render.yml.description: Use the specified file as a custom template for the generated document.

schema/document-render.yml.name: template-partials
schema/document-render.yml.description: Include the specified files as partials accessible to the template for the generated content.

schema/document-render.yml.name: standalone
schema/document-render.yml.description: Produce output with an appropriate header and footer (e.g. a standalone HTML, LaTeX, TEI, or RTF file, not a fragment)

description.short: Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies
description.long:
Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies, using
`data:` URIs to incorporate the contents of linked scripts, stylesheets,
images, and videos. The resulting file should be "self-contained," in the
sense that it needs no external files and no net access to be displayed
properly by a browser. This option works only with HTML output formats,
including `html4`, `html5`, `html+lhs`, `html5+lhs`, `s5`, `slidy`,
`slideous`, `dzslides`, and `revealjs`. Scripts, images, and stylesheets at
absolute URLs will be downloaded; those at relative URLs will be sought
relative to the working directory (if the first source
file is local) or relative to the base URL (if the first source
file is remote).  Elements with the attribute
`data-external="1"` will be left alone; the documents they
link to will not be incorporated in the document.
Limitation: resources that are loaded dynamically through
JavaScript cannot be incorporated; as a result, some
advanced features (e.g.  zoom or speaker notes) may not work
in an offline "self-contained" `reveal.js` slide show.

description.short: Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies
description.long:
Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies. Note that
this option has been deprecated in favor of `embed-resources`.

description.short: Embed math libraries (e.g. MathJax) within `self-contained` output.
description.long:
Embed math libraries (e.g. MathJax) within `self-contained` output.
Note that math libraries are not embedded by default because they are 
 quite large and often time consuming to download.

schema/document-render.yml.name: filters
schema/document-render.yml.description:
Specify executables or Lua scripts to be used as a filter transforming
the pandoc AST after the input is parsed and before the output is written.

schema/document-render.yml.name: shortcodes
schema/document-render.yml.description: Specify Lua scripts that implement shortcode handlers

schema/document-render.yml.name: keep-md
schema/document-render.yml.description: Keep the markdown file generated by executing code

schema/document-render.yml.name: keep-ipynb
schema/document-render.yml.description: Keep the notebook file generated from executing code.

schema/document-render.yml.name: ipynb-filters
schema/document-render.yml.description: Filters to pre-process ipynb files before rendering to markdown

schema/document-render.yml.name: keep-typ
schema/document-render.yml.description: Keep the intermediate typst file used during render.

schema/document-render.yml.name: keep-tex
schema/document-render.yml.description: Keep the intermediate tex file used during render.

description.short:
Extract images and other media contained in or linked from the source document to the
path DIR.
description.long:
Extract images and other media contained in or linked from the source document to the
path DIR, creating it if necessary, and adjust the images references in the document
so they point to the extracted files. Media are downloaded, read from the file
system, or extracted from a binary container (e.g. docx), as needed. The original
file paths are used if they are relative paths not containing ... Otherwise filenames
are constructed from the SHA1 hash of the contents.

schema/document-render.yml.name: resource-path
schema/document-render.yml.description: List of paths to search for images and other resources.

description.short: Specify a default extension to use when image paths/URLs have no extension.
description.long:
Specify a default extension to use when image paths/URLs have no
extension.  This allows you to use the same source for formats that
require different kinds of images.  Currently this option only affects
the Markdown and LaTeX readers.

description.short: Specifies a custom abbreviations file, with abbreviations one to a line.
description.long:
Specifies a custom abbreviations file, with abbreviations one to a line.
This list is used when reading Markdown input: strings found in this list
will be followed by a nonbreaking space, and the period will not produce sentence-ending space in formats like LaTeX.  The strings may not contain
spaces.

description.short:
Specify the default dpi (dots per inch) value for conversion from pixels to inch/
centimeters and vice versa.
description.long:
Specify the default dpi (dots per inch) value for conversion from pixels to inch/
centimeters and vice versa. (Technically, the correct term would be ppi: pixels per
inch.) The default is `96`. When images contain information about dpi internally, the
encoded value is used instead of the default specified by this option.

schema/document-reveal-content.yml.name: logo
schema/document-reveal-content.yml.description: Logo image (placed in bottom right corner of slides)

description.short: Footer to include on all slides
description.long:
Footer to include on all slides. Can also be set per-slide by including a
div with class `.footer` on the slide.

description.short: Allow content that overflows slides vertically to scroll
description.long:
`true` to allow content that overflows slides vertically to scroll. This can also
be set per-slide by including the `.scrollable` class on the slide title.

description.short: Use a smaller default font for slide content
description.long:
`true` to use a smaller default font for slide content. This can also
be set per-slide by including the `.smaller` class on the slide title.

description.short: Location of output relative to the code that generated it (`default`, `fragment`, `slide`, `column`, or `column-location`)
description.long:
Location of output relative to the code that generated it. The possible values are as follows:

- `default`: Normal flow of the slide after the code
- `fragment`: In a fragment (not visible until you advance)
- `slide`: On a new slide after the curent one
- 'column': In an adjacent column 
- `column-fragment`:   In an adjacent column (not visible until you advance)

Note that this option is supported only for the `revealjs` format.

schema/document-reveal-hidden.yml.name: embedded
schema/document-reveal-hidden.yml.description: Flags if the presentation is running in an embedded mode

schema/document-reveal-hidden.yml.name: display
schema/document-reveal-hidden.yml.description: The display mode that will be used to show slides

schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.name: auto-stretch
schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.description: For slides with a single top-level image, automatically stretch it to fill the slide.

description.short: The 'normal' width of the presentation
description.long:
The "normal" width of the presentation, aspect ratio will
be preserved when the presentation is scaled to fit different
resolutions. Can be specified using percentage units.

description.short: The 'normal' height of the presentation
description.long:
The "normal" height of the presentation, aspect ratio will
be preserved when the presentation is scaled to fit different
resolutions. Can be specified using percentage units.

schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.name: margin

string.description: Horizontal margin (e.g. 5cm)
Vertical margin (e.g. 5cm)
Top margin (e.g. 5cm)
Bottom margin (e.g. 5cm)
Left margin (e.g. 5cm)
Right margin (e.g. 5cm)

schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.description:
For `revealjs`, the factor of the display size that should remain empty around the content (e.g. 0.1).

For `typst`, a dictionary with the fields defined in the Typst documentation:
`x`, `y`, `top`, `bottom`, `left`, `right` (margins are specified in `cm` units,
e.g. `5cm`).

schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.name: min-scale
schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.description: Bounds for smallest possible scale to apply to content

schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.name: max-scale
schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.description: Bounds for largest possible scale to apply to content

schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.name: disable-layout
schema/document-reveal-layout.yml.description: Disables the default reveal.js slide layout (scaling and centering)

description.short: Open links in an iframe preview overlay (`true`, `false`, or `auto`)
description.long:
Open links in an iframe preview overlay.

- `true`: Open links in iframe preview overlay
- `false`: Do not open links in iframe preview overlay
- `auto` (default): Open links in iframe preview overlay, in fullscreen mode.

schema/document-reveal-media.yml.name: auto-play-media
schema/document-reveal-media.yml.description:
Autoplay embedded media (`null`, `true`, or `false`). Default is `null` (only when `autoplay` 
attribute is specified)

description.short: Global override for preloading lazy-loaded iframes (`null`, `true`, or `false`).
description.long:
Global override for preloading lazy-loaded iframes

- `null`:   Iframes with data-src AND data-preload will be loaded when within
  the `viewDistance`, iframes with only data-src will be loaded when visible
- `true`:   All iframes with data-src will be loaded when within the viewDistance
- `false`:  All iframes with data-src will be loaded only when visible

schema/document-reveal-media.yml.name: view-distance
schema/document-reveal-media.yml.description: Number of slides away from the current slide to pre-load resources for

schema/document-reveal-media.yml.name: mobile-view-distance
schema/document-reveal-media.yml.description: Number of slides away from the current slide to pre-load resources for (on mobile devices).

schema/document-reveal-media.yml.name: parallax-background-horizontal
schema/document-reveal-media.yml.description: Number of pixels to move the parallax background horizontally per slide.

schema/document-reveal-media.yml.name: parallax-background-vertical
schema/document-reveal-media.yml.description: Number of pixels to move the parallax background vertically per slide.

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: progress
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Display a presentation progress bar

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: history
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Push each slide change to the browser history

description.short: Navigation progression (`linear`, `vertical`, or `grid`)
description.long:
Changes the behavior of navigation directions.

- `linear`: Removes the up/down arrows. Left/right arrows step through all
  slides (both horizontal and vertical).

- `vertical`: Left/right arrow keys step between horizontal slides, up/down
  arrow keys step between vertical slides. Space key steps through
  all slides (both horizontal and vertical).

- `grid`: When this is enabled, stepping left/right from a vertical stack
  to an adjacent vertical stack will land you at the same vertical
  index.

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: touch
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Enable touch navigation on devices with touch input

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: keyboard
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Enable keyboard shortcuts for navigation

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: mouse-wheel
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Enable slide navigation via mouse wheel

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: hide-inactive-cursor
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Hide cursor if inactive

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: hide-cursor-time
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Time before the cursor is hidden (in ms)

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: loop
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Loop the presentation

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: shuffle
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Randomize the order of slides each time the presentation loads

description.short: Show arrow controls for navigating through slides (`true`, `false`, or `auto`).
description.long:
Show arrow controls for navigating through slides.

- `true`: Always show controls
- `false`: Never show controls
- `auto` (default): Show controls when vertical slides are present or when the deck is embedded in an iframe.

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: controls-layout
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Location for navigation controls (`edges` or `bottom-right`)

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: controls-tutorial
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Help the user learn the controls by providing visual hints.

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: controls-back-arrows
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Visibility rule for backwards navigation arrows (`faded`, `hidden`, or `visible`).

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: auto-slide
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Automatically progress all slides at the specified interval

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: auto-slide-stoppable
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Stop auto-sliding after user input

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: auto-slide-method
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Navigation method to use when auto sliding (defaults to navigateNext)

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: default-timing
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Expected average seconds per slide (used by pacing timer in speaker view)

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: pause
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Flags whether it should be possible to pause the presentation (blackout)

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: help
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Show a help overlay when the `?` key is pressed

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: hash
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Add the current slide to the URL hash

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: hash-type
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: URL hash type (`number` or `title`)

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: hash-one-based-index
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Use 1 based indexing for hash links to match slide number

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: respond-to-hash-changes
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Monitor the hash and change slides accordingly

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: fragment-in-url
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Include the current fragment in the URL

schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.name: slide-tone
schema/document-reveal-navigation.yml.description: Play a subtle sound when changing slides

schema/document-reveal-print.yml.name: pdf-separate-fragments
schema/document-reveal-print.yml.description: Prints each fragment on a separate slide

description.short: Offset used to reduce the height of content within exported PDF pages.
description.long:
Offset used to reduce the height of content within exported PDF pages.
This exists to account for environment differences based on how you
print to PDF. CLI printing options, like phantomjs and wkpdf, can end
on precisely the total height of the document whereas in-browser
printing has to end one pixel before.

side.description: Side of the presentation where the menu will be shown (`left` or `right`)

boolean.description: Add slide numbers to menu items
For slides with no title, attempt to use the start of the text content as the title instead.

theme.description: Visual theme for drawing surface (`chalkboard` or `whiteboard`)

number.description: The drawing width of the boardmarker. Defaults to 3. Larger values draw thicker lines.
The drawing width of the chalk. Defaults to 7. Larger values draw thicker lines.

path.description: Optional file name for pre-recorded drawings (download drawings using the `D` key)

boolean.description: Configuration option to prevent changes to existing drawings
Add chalkboard buttons at the bottom of the slide

number.description:
Gives the duration (in ms) of the transition for a slide change, 
so that the notes canvas is drawn after the transition is completed.

string.description: Multiplex token server (defaults to Reveal-hosted server)
Unique presentation id provided by multiplex token server
Secret provided by multiplex token server

description.short: Transition style for slides
description.long:
Transition style for slides backgrounds.
(`none`, `fade`, `slide`, `convex`, `concave`, or `zoom`)

description.short: Transition style for full page slide backgrounds
description.long:
Transition style for full page slide backgrounds.
(`none`, `fade`, `slide`, `convex`, `concave`, or `zoom`)

schema/document-reveal-transitions.yml.name: fragments
schema/document-reveal-transitions.yml.description: Turns fragments on and off globally

description.short: Default CSS easing function for auto-animation
description.long:
Default CSS easing function for auto-animation.
Can be overridden per-slide or per-element via attributes.

description.short: Duration (in seconds) of auto-animate transition
description.long:
Duration (in seconds) of auto-animate transition.
Can be overridden per-slide or per-element via attributes.

description.short: Auto-animate unmatched elements.
description.long:
Auto-animate unmatched elements.
Can be overridden per-slide or per-element via attributes.

description.short:
CSS properties that can be auto-animated (positional styles like top, left, etc.
are always animated).

schema/document-slides.yml.name: incremental
schema/document-slides.yml.description:
Make list items in slide shows display incrementally (one by one). 
The default is for lists to be displayed all at once.

description.short:
Specifies that headings with the specified level create slides.
Headings above this level in the hierarchy are used to divide 
the slide show into sections.
description.long:
Specifies that headings with the specified level create slides.
Headings above this level in the hierarchy are used to divide 
the slide show into sections; headings below this level create 
subheads within a slide. Valid values are 0-6. If a slide level
of 0 is specified, slides will not be split automatically on 
headings, and horizontal rules must be used to indicate slide 
boundaries. If a slide level is not specified explicitly, the
slide level will be set automatically based on the contents of
the document

description.short: Display the page number of the current slide
description.long:
Display the page number of the current slide

- `true`:    Show slide number
- `false`:   Hide slide number

Can optionally be set as a string that specifies the number formatting:

- `h.v`:   Horizontal . vertical slide number
- `h/v`:   Horizontal / vertical slide number
- `c`:   Flattened slide number
- `c/t`:   Flattened slide number / total slides (default)

schema/document-slides.yml.name: show-slide-number
schema/document-slides.yml.description: Contexts in which the slide number appears (`all`, `print`, or `speaker`)

string.description: CSS color for title slide background
URL or path to the background image.
CSS background size (defaults to `cover`)
CSS background position (defaults to `center`)
CSS background repeat (defaults to `no-repeat`)

Opacity of the background image on a 0-1 scale. 
0 is transparent and 1 is fully opaque.

description.short: Additional attributes for the title slide of a reveal.js presentation.
description.long:
Additional attributes for the title slide of a reveal.js presentation as a map of 
attribute names and values. For example

```yaml
  title-slide-attributes:
      data-background-image: /path/to/title_image.png
      data-background-size: contain      
```

(Note that the data- prefix is required here, as it isn’t added automatically.)

schema/document-slides.yml.name: title-slide-style
schema/document-slides.yml.description: The title slide style. Use `pandoc` to select the Pandoc default title slide style.

schema/document-slides.yml.name: show-notes
schema/document-slides.yml.description: Make speaker notes visible to all viewers

schema/document-slides.yml.name: rtl
schema/document-slides.yml.description: Change the presentation direction to be RTL

description.short:
Method used to print tables in Knitr engine documents (`default`,
`kable`, `tibble`, or `paged`). Uses `default` if not specified.
description.long:
Method used to print tables in Knitr engine documents:

-  `default`: Use the default S3 method for the data frame.
-  `kable`: Markdown table using the `knitr::kable()` function.
-  `tibble`: Plain text table using the `tibble` package.
-  `paged`: HTML table with paging for row and column overflow.

The default printing method is `kable`.

description.short: Determine how text is wrapped in the output (`auto`, `none`, or `preserve`).
description.long:
Determine how text is wrapped in the output (the source code, not the rendered
version). 

- `auto` (default): Pandoc will attempt to wrap lines to the column width specified by `columns` (default 72). 
- `none`: Pandoc will not wrap lines at all. 
- `preserve`: Pandoc will attempt to preserve the wrapping from the source
  document. Where there are nonsemantic newlines in the source, there will be
  nonsemantic newlines in the output as well.

description.short: For text formats, specify length of lines in characters. For `typst`, number of columns for body text.
description.long:
Specify length of lines in characters. This affects text wrapping in generated source
code (see `wrap`). It also affects calculation of column widths for plain text
tables. 

For `typst`, number of columns for body text.

description.short: Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4).
description.long:
Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4). Note that tabs
within normal textual input are always converted to spaces. Tabs 
within code are also converted, however this can be disabled with
`preserve-tabs: false`.

description.short: Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces.
description.long:
Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces.
(By default, pandoc converts tabs to spaces before parsing its input.) 
Note that this will only affect tabs in literal code spans and code blocks. 
Tabs in regular text are always treated as spaces.

description.short: Manually specify line endings (`lf`, `crlf`, or `native`).
description.long:
Manually specify line endings: 

- `crlf`: Use Windows line endings
- `lf`: Use macOS/Linux/UNIX line endings
- `native` (default): Use line endings appropriate to the OS on which pandoc is being run).

description.short: Strip out HTML comments in source, rather than passing them on to output.
description.long:
Strip out HTML comments in the Markdown source,
rather than passing them on to Markdown, Textile or HTML
output as raw HTML.  This does not apply to HTML comments
inside raw HTML blocks when the `markdown_in_html_blocks`
extension is not set.

description.short: Use only ASCII characters in output.
description.long:
Use only ASCII characters in output. Currently supported for XML
and HTML formats (which use entities instead of UTF-8 when this
option is selected), CommonMark, gfm, and Markdown (which use
entities), roff ms (which use hexadecimal escapes), and to a
limited degree LaTeX (which uses standard commands for accented
characters when possible). roff man output uses ASCII by default.

description.short: Include an automatically generated table of contents
description.long:
Include an automatically generated table of contents (or, in
the case of `latex`, `context`, `docx`, `odt`,
`opendocument`, `rst`, or `ms`, an instruction to create
one) in the output document. This option has no effect
if `standalone` is `false`.

Note that if you are producing a PDF via `ms`, the table
of contents will appear at the beginning of the
document, before the title.  If you would prefer it to
be at the end of the document, use the option
`pdf-engine-opt: --no-toc-relocation`.

schema/document-toc.yml.name: toc-depth
schema/document-toc.yml.description:
Specify the number of section levels to include in the table of contents.
The default is 3

schema/document-toc.yml.name: toc-location
schema/document-toc.yml.description: Location for table of contents (`body`, `left`, or `right` (default)).

schema/document-toc.yml.name: toc-title
schema/document-toc.yml.description: The title used for the table of contents.

schema/document-toc.yml.name: toc-expand
schema/document-toc.yml.description: Specifies the depth of items in the table of contents that should be displayed as expanded in HTML output. Use `true` to expand all or `false` to collapse all.

schema/document-toc.yml.name: lof
schema/document-toc.yml.description: Print a list of figures in the document.

schema/document-toc.yml.name: lot
schema/document-toc.yml.description: Print a list of tables in the document.

schema/document-website.yml.name: search
schema/document-website.yml.description: Setting this to false prevents this document from being included in searches.

schema/document-website.yml.name: aliases
schema/document-website.yml.description: URLs that alias this document, when included in a website.

description.short: The path to a preview image for this document.
description.long:
The path to a preview image for this content. By default, 
Quarto will use the image value from the site: metadata. 
If you provide an image, you may also optionally provide 
an image-width and image-height to improve 
the appearance of your Twitter Card.

If image is not provided, Quarto will automatically attempt 
to locate a preview image.

schema/document-website.yml.name: image-height
schema/document-website.yml.description: The height of the preview image for this document.

schema/document-website.yml.name: image-width
schema/document-website.yml.description: The width of the preview image for this document.

schema/document-website.yml.name: image-alt
schema/document-website.yml.description: The alt text for preview image on this page.

schema/extension.yml.name: quarto-required
schema/extension.yml.description: Quarto version range. See https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v6/using-npm/semver for syntax details.

execute.title: Execution
execute.description:
Execution options should be specified within the `execute` key. For example:

```yaml
execute:
  echo: false
  warning: false
```

string.description: Project type (`default`, `website`, `book`, or `manuscript`)

render.description: Files to render (defaults to all files)

description.short: Working directory for computations
description.long:
Control the working directory for computations. 

- `file`: Use the directory of the file that is currently executing.
- `project`: Use the root directory of the project.

maybeArrayOf.description: Additional file resources to be copied to output directory

pre-render.description: Scripts to run as a pre-render step

post-render.description: Scripts to run as a post-render step

detect.description: Array of paths used to detect the project type within a directory

schema/project.yml.name: type
schema/project.yml.errorMessage: type key not supported at project type-level. Use `project: type: ...` instead.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Automatically generate sidebar contents.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Automatically generate sidebar contents. Pass true to include all documents in the site, a directory name to include only documents in that directory, or a glob (or list of globs) to include documents based on a pattern. Subdirectories will create sections (use an index.qmd in the directory to provide its title). Order will be alphabetical unless a numeric order field is provided in document metadata.

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Accessible label for the item.
Alias for href
Link to file contained with the project or external URL

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Name of bootstrap icon (e.g. github, twitter, share)
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Name of bootstrap icon (e.g. github, twitter, share) See https://icons.getbootstrap.com/ for a list of available icons

schema/html-descriptions.yml:
Text to display for item (defaults to the document title if not
provided)
Alias for href
Value for rel attribute. Multiple space-separated values are permitted. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/rel for a details.
Value for target attribute. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a#attr-target for details.
The Github repo that will be used to store comments.
The label that will be assigned to issues created by Utterances.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The Github theme that should be used for Utterances.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The Github theme that should be used for Utterances (github-light, github-dark, github-dark-orange, icy-dark, dark-blue, photon-dark, body-light, or gruvbox-dark)

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: How posts should be mapped to Github issues
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: How posts should be mapped to Github issues (pathname, url, title or og:title)

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The Github repo that will be used to store comments.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The Github repo that will be used to store comments.
In order to work correctly, the repo must be public, with the giscus
app installed, and the discussions feature must be enabled.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The Github repository identifier.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The Github repository identifier. You can quickly find this by using the configuration tool at https://giscus.app. If this is not provided, Quarto will attempt to discover it at render time.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The discussion category where new discussions will be created.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The discussion category where new discussions will be created. It is recommended to use a category with the Announcements type so that new discussions can only be created by maintainers and giscus.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The Github category identifier.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The Github category identifier. You can quickly find this by using the configuration tool at https://giscus.app. If this is not provided, Quarto will attempt to discover it at render time.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The mapping between the page and the embedded discussion.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The mapping between the page and the embedded discussion.

The title of the page. Note that by default Quarto will automatically
use the title metadata from the page. Specify this field if you’d like
to override the title for this provider.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
A short description of the content. Note that by default Quarto will
automatically use the description metadata from the page. Specify this
field if you’d like to override the description for this provider.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The path to a preview image for the content. By default, Quarto will use the image value from the format metadata. If you provide an image, you may also optionally provide an image-width and image-height.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The alt text for the preview image.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The alt text for the preview image. By default, Quarto will use the image-alt value from the format metadata. If you provide an image, you may also optionally provide an image-width and image-height.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The target id for the about page.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The target id of this about page. When the about page is rendered, it will place read the contents of a div with this id into the about template that you have selected (and replace the contents with the rendered about content). If no such div is defined on the page, a div with this id will be created and appended to the end of the page.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The template to use to layout this about page.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The template to use to layout this about page. Choose from:

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The path to the main image on the about page.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: A valid CSS width for the about page image.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The shape of the image on the about page.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The shape of the image on the about page.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The id of this listing.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The id of this listing. When the listing is rendered, it will place the contents into a div with this id. If no such div is defined on the page, a div with this id will be created and appended to the end of the page. In no id is provided for a listing, Quarto will synthesize one when rendering the page.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The type of listing to create.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The type of listing to create. Choose one of:

schema/html-descriptions.yml:
The files or path globs of Quarto documents or YAML files that should
be included in the listing.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Sort items in the listing by these fields.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Sort items in the listing by these fields. The sort key is made up of a field name followed by a direction asc or desc. For example: date asc Use sort:false to use the unsorted original order of items.

schema/html-descriptions.yml: The maximum number of items to include in this listing.
The number of items to display on a page.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Shows or hides the sorting control for the listing.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Shows or hides the sorting control for the listing. To control the
fields that will be displayed in the sorting control, provide a list of
field names.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Shows or hides the filtering control for the listing.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Shows or hides the filtering control for the listing. To control the
fields that will be used to filter the listing, provide a list of field
names. By default all fields of the listing will be used when
filtering.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Display item categories from this listing in the margin of the
page.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Display item categories from this listing in the margin of the
page.

The number of items to include in your feed. Defaults to 20.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Whether to include full or partial content in the feed.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The title for this feed.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The title for this feed. Defaults to the site title provided the
Quarto project.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The path to an image for this feed. If not specified, the image for
the page the listing appears on will be used, otherwise an image will be
used if specified for the site in the Quarto project.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The description of this feed. If not specified, the description for
the page the listing appears on will be used, otherwise the description
of the site will be used if specified in the Quarto project.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The language of the feed. Omitted if not specified. See https://www.rssboard.org/rss-language-codes for a list of valid language codes.

The width is automatically determined and the image will fill the

A mapping that provides display names for specific fields. For
example, to display the title column as ‘Report’ in a table listing you
would write:

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Provides the date type for the field of a listing item.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: This list of fields to display as links in a table listing.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: The list of fields to display as hyperlinks to the source document when the listing type is a table. By default, only the title or filename is displayed as a link.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Fields that items in this listing must have populated.

Fields that items in this listing must have populated. If a listing
is rendered and one more items in this listing is missing a required
field, an error will occur and the render will.

listing.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Whether to cache a code chunk.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Whether to cache a code chunk. When evaluating code chunks for the second time, the cached chunks are skipped (unless they have been modified), but the objects created in these chunks are loaded from previously saved databases (.rdb and .rdx files), and these files are saved when a chunk is evaluated for the first time, or when cached files are not found (e.g., you may have removed them by hand). Note that the filename consists of the chunk label with an MD5 digest of the R code and chunk options of the code chunk, which means any changes in the chunk will produce a different MD5 digest, and hence invalidate the cache.

schema/html-descriptions.yml: A prefix to be used to generate the paths of cache files

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Variable names to be saved in the cache database.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Variable names to be saved in the cache database. By default, all
variables created in the current chunks are identified and saved, but
you may want to manually specify the variables to be saved, because the
automatic detection of variables may not be robust, or you may want to
save only a subset of variables.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Variables names that are not created from the current chunk
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Variables names that are not created from the current chunk. This option is mainly for autodep: true to work more precisely—a chunk B depends on chunk A when any of B’s global variables are A’s local variables. In case the automatic detection of global variables in a chunk fails, you may manually specify the names of global variables via this option. In addition, cache-globals: false means detecting all variables in a code chunk, no matter if they are global or local variables.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Whether to lazyLoad() or directly load() objects
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Whether to lazyLoad() or directly load() objects. For very large objects, lazyloading may not work, so cache-lazy: false may be desirable (see #572).

variables

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Width of the plot in the output document, which can be different from its physical fig-width, i.e., plots can be scaled in the output document. When used without a unit, the unit is assumed to be pixels. However, any of the following unit identifiers can be used: px, cm, mm, in, inch and %, for example, 3in, 8cm, 300px or 50%.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Height of the plot in the output document, which can be different from its physical fig-height, i.e., plots can be scaled in the output document. Depending on the output format, this option can take special values. For example, for LaTeX output, it can be 3in, or 8cm; for HTML, it can be 300px.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Number section headings

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: By default, all headings in your document create a numbered section. You customize numbering depth using the number-depth option. For example, to only number sections immediately below the chapter level, use this:

schema/html-descriptions.yml: The numbering depth for sections. (Use number-depth instead).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default)
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default) The first number is added to the section number for top-level headings, the second for second-level headings, and so on. So, for example, if you want the first top-level heading in your document to be numbered “6”, specify number-offset: 5. If your document starts with a level-2 heading which you want to be numbered “1.5”, specify number-offset: [1,4]. Implies number-sections

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Schema to use for numbering sections, e.g. 1.A.1

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer. For example, with shift-heading-level-by: -1, level 2 headings become level 1 headings.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer. For example, with shift-heading-level-by: -1, level 2 headings become level 1 headings, and level 3 headings become level 2 headings. Headings cannot have a level less than 1, so a heading that would be shifted below level 1 becomes a regular paragraph. Exception: with a shift of -N, a level-N heading at the beginning of the document replaces the metadata title.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Sets the page numbering style and location for the document.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Sets the page numbering style and location for the document using the \setuppagenumbering command. See ConTeXt Page Numbering for additional information.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Treat top-level headings as the given division type (default, section, chapter, or part). The hierarchy order is part, chapter, then section; all headings are shifted such that the top-level heading becomes the specified type.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Treat top-level headings as the given division type (default, section, chapter, or part). The hierarchy order is part, chapter, then section; all headings are shifted such that the top-level heading becomes the specified type. The default behavior is to determine the best division type via heuristics: unless other conditions apply, section is chosen. When the documentclass variable is set to report, book, or memoir (unless the article option is specified), chapter is implied as the setting for this option. If beamer is the output format, specifying either chapter or part will cause top-level headings to become \part{..}, while second-level headings remain as their default type.

schema/html-descriptions.yml: If true, force the presence of the OJS runtime. If false, force the absence instead. If unset, the OJS runtime is included only if OJS cells are present in the document.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: If true (the default for note styles), Quarto (via Pandoc) will put footnote references or superscripted numerical citations after following punctuation. For example, if the source contains blah blah [@jones99]., the result will look like blah blah.[^1], with the note moved after the period and the space collapsed. If false, the space will still be collapsed, but the footnote will not be moved after the punctuation. The option may also be used in numerical styles that use superscripts for citation numbers (but for these styles the default is not to move the citation).
