schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies, using data: URIs to incorporate the contents of linked scripts, stylesheets, images, and videos. The resulting file should be “self-contained,” in the sense that it needs no external files and no net access to be displayed properly by a browser. This option works only with HTML output formats, including html4, html5, html+lhs, html5+lhs, s5, slidy, slideous, dzslides, and revealjs. Scripts, images, and stylesheets at absolute URLs will be downloaded; those at relative URLs will be sought relative to the working directory (if the first source file is local) or relative to the base URL (if the first source file is remote). Elements with the attribute data-external="1" will be left alone; the documents they link to will not be incorporated in the document. Limitation: resources that are loaded dynamically through JavaScript cannot be incorporated; as a result, some advanced features (e.g. zoom or speaker notes) may not work in an offline “self-contained” reveal.js slide show.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Method used to print tables in Knitr engine documents:

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Determine how text is wrapped in the output (auto, none, or preserve).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Determine how text is wrapped in the output (the source code, not the
rendered version).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: For text formats, specify length of lines in characters. For typst, number of columns for body text.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Specify length of lines in characters. This affects text wrapping in generated source code (see wrap). It also affects calculation of column widths for plain text tables. For typst, number of columns for body text.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4). Note that tabs within normal textual input are always converted to spaces. Tabs within code are also converted, however this can be disabled with preserve-tabs: false.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces. (By
default, pandoc converts tabs to spaces before parsing its input.) Note
that this will only affect tabs in literal code spans and code blocks.
Tabs in regular text are always treated as spaces.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Manually specify line endings (lf, crlf, or native).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Manually specify line endings:

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Strip out HTML comments in source, rather than passing them on to
output.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Strip out HTML comments in the Markdown source, rather than passing them on to Markdown, Textile or HTML output as raw HTML. This does not apply to HTML comments inside raw HTML blocks when the markdown_in_html_blocks extension is not set.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Use only ASCII characters in output.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Use only ASCII characters in output. Currently supported for XML and
HTML formats (which use entities instead of UTF-8 when this option is
selected), CommonMark, gfm, and Markdown (which use entities), roff ms
(which use hexadecimal escapes), and to a limited degree LaTeX (which
uses standard commands for accented characters when possible). roff man
output uses ASCII by default.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Include an automatically generated table of contents
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Include an automatically generated table of contents (or, in the case of latex, context, docx, odt, opendocument, rst, or ms, an instruction to create one) in the output document. This option has no effect if standalone is false. Note that if you are producing a PDF via ms, the table of contents will appear at the beginning of the document, before the title. If you would prefer it to be at the end of the document, use the option pdf-engine-opt: --no-toc-relocation.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Include an automatically generated table of contents
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Include an automatically generated table of contents (or, in the case of latex, context, docx, odt, opendocument, rst, or ms, an instruction to create one) in the output document. This option has no effect if standalone is false. Note that if you are producing a PDF via ms, the table of contents will appear at the beginning of the document, before the title. If you would prefer it to be at the end of the document, use the option pdf-engine-opt: --no-toc-relocation.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Short markup, decoration, or annotation to the item (e.g., to
indicate items included in a review).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Short markup, decoration, or annotation to the item (e.g., to indicate items included in a review); For descriptive text (e.g., in an annotated bibliography), use note instead

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Archive storing the item
Collection the item is part of within an archive.

Storage location within an archive (e.g. a box and folder
number).
Geographic location of the archive.

Issuing or judicial authority (e.g. “USPTO” for a patent, “Fairfax
Circuit Court” for a legal case).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Date the item was initially available
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Date the item was initially available (e.g. the online publication
date of a journal article before its formal publication date; the date a
treaty was made available for signing).

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Call number (to locate the item in a library).
The person leading the session containing a presentation (e.g. the organizer of the container-title of a speech).

Chapter number (e.g. chapter number in a book; track number on an
album).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Identifier of the item in the input data file (analogous to BiTeX
entrykey).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Identifier of the item in the input data file (analogous to BiTeX entrykey); Use this variable to facilitate conversion between word-processor and plain-text writing systems; For an identifer intended as formatted output label for a citation (e.g. “Ferr78”), use citation-label instead

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Label identifying the item in in-text citations of label styles
(e.g. “Ferr78”).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Label identifying the item in in-text citations of label styles (e.g. “Ferr78”); May be assigned by the CSL processor based on item metadata; For the identifier of the item in the input data file, use citation-key instead

schema/html-descriptions.yml:
Index (starting at 1) of the cited reference in the bibliography
(generated by the CSL processor).

Editor of the collection holding the item (e.g. the series editor for
a book).

Number identifying the collection holding the item (e.g. the series
number for a book)

Title of the collection holding the item (e.g. the series title for a
book; the lecture series title for a presentation).

Person compiling or selecting material for an item from the works of
various persons or bodies (e.g. for an anthology).
Composer (e.g. of a musical score).

Author of the container holding the item (e.g. the book author for a
book chapter).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Title of the container holding the item.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Title of the container holding the item (e.g. the book title for a
book chapter, the journal title for a journal article; the album title
for a recording; the session title for multi-part presentation at a
conference)

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Short/abbreviated form of container-title;

A minor contributor to the item; typically cited using “with” before
the name when listed in a bibliography.
Curator of an exhibit or collection (e.g. in a museum).

Physical (e.g. size) or temporal (e.g. running time) dimensions of
the item.
Director (e.g. of a film).
Minor subdivision of a court with a jurisdiction for a legal item

(Container) edition holding the item (e.g. “3” when citing a chapter
in the third edition of a book).
The editor of the item.
Managing editor (“Directeur de la Publication” in French).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Combined editor and translator of a work.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Combined editor and translator of a work.
The citation processory must be automatically generate if editor and
translator variables are identical; May also be provided directly in
item data.

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Date the event related to an item took place.

Name of the event related to the item (e.g. the conference name when
citing a conference paper; the meeting where presentation was made).

Geographic location of the event related to the item
(e.g. “Amsterdam, The Netherlands”).
Executive producer of the item (e.g. of a television series).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Number of a preceding note containing the first reference to the
item.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Number of a preceding note containing the first reference to the
item
Assigned by the CSL processor; Empty in non-note-based styles or when
the item hasn’t been cited in any preceding notes in a document

schema/html-descriptions.yml: A url to the full text for this item.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Type, class, or subtype of the item

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Guest (e.g. on a TV show or podcast).
Host of the item (e.g. of a TV show or podcast).
Illustrator (e.g. of a children’s book or graphic novel).
Interviewer (e.g. of an interview).
International Standard Book Number (e.g. “978-3-8474-1017-1”).
International Standard Serial Number.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Issue number of the item or container holding the item

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Date the item was issued/published.

Geographic scope of relevance (e.g. “US” for a US patent; the court
hearing a legal case).
Keyword(s) or tag(s) attached to the item.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The language of the item (used only for citation of the item).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The language of the item (used only for citation of the item).
Should be entered as an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code
(e.g. “en”, “zh”), optionally with a two-letter locale code
(e.g. “de-DE”, “de-AT”).
This does not change the language of the item, instead it documents
what language the item uses (which may be used in citing the item).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The license information applicable to an item.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The license information applicable to an item (e.g. the license an
article or software is released under; the copyright information for an
item; the classification status of a document)

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: A cite-specific pinpointer within the item.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
A cite-specific pinpointer within the item (e.g. a page number within
a book, or a volume in a multi-volume work).
Must be accompanied in the input data by a label indicating the
locator type (see the Locators term list).

schema/html-descriptions.yml:
Description of the item’s format or medium (e.g. “CD”, “DVD”,
“Album”, etc.)
Narrator (e.g. of an audio book).

Descriptive text or notes about an item (e.g. in an annotated
bibliography).
Number identifying the item (e.g. a report number).
Total number of pages of the cited item.

Total number of volumes, used when citing multi-volume books and
such.

Organizer of an event (e.g. organizer of a workshop or
conference).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: The original creator of a work.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
The original creator of a work (e.g. the form of the author name
listed on the original version of a book; the historical author of a
work; the original songwriter or performer for a musical piece; the
original developer or programmer for a piece of software; the original
author of an adapted work such as a book adapted into a screenplay)

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Issue date of the original version.

Original publisher, for items that have been republished by a
different publisher.

Geographic location of the original publisher (e.g. “London,
UK”).

Title of the original version (e.g. “Война и мир”, the untranslated
Russian title of “War and Peace”).

Range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a
container (e.g. a journal issue).

First page of the range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article)
covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue).

Last page of the range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article)
covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Number of the specific part of the item being cited (e.g. part 2 of a
journal article).
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Number of the specific part of the item being cited (e.g. part 2 of a journal article). Use part-title for the title of the part, if any.

schema/html-descriptions.yml: Title of the specific part of an item being cited.
A url to the pdf for this item.

Performer of an item (e.g. an actor appearing in a film; a muscian
performing a piece of music).
PubMed Central reference number.
PubMed reference number.
Printing number of the item or container holding the item.
Producer (e.g. of a television or radio broadcast).
A public url for this item.
The publisher of the item.
The geographic location of the publisher.
Recipient (e.g. of a letter).
Author of the item reviewed by the current item.

Type of the item being reviewed by the current item (e.g. book,
film).
Title of the item reviewed by the current item.
Scale of e.g. a map or model.
Writer of a script or screenplay (e.g. of a film).

Section of the item or container holding the item (e.g. “§2.0.1” for
a law; “politics” for a newspaper article).
Creator of a series (e.g. of a television series).

Source from whence the item originates (e.g. a library catalog or
database).

Publication status of the item (e.g. “forthcoming”; “in press”;
“advance online publication”; “retracted”)
Date the item (e.g. a manuscript) was submitted for publication.

Supplement number of the item or container holding the item (e.g. for
secondary legal items that are regularly updated between editions).
Short/abbreviated form oftitle.
Translator
The type of the item.

Uniform Resource Locator
(e.g. “https://aem.asm.org/cgi/content/full/74/9/2766”)
Version of the item (e.g. “2.0.9” for a software program).

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short:
Volume number of the item (e.g. “2” when citing volume 2 of a book)
or the container holding the item.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long: Volume number of the item (e.g. “2” when citing volume 2 of a book) or the container holding the item (e.g. “2” when citing a chapter from volume 2 of a book). Use volume-title for the title of the volume, if any.

schema/html-descriptions.yml.short: Title of the volume of the item or container holding the item.
schema/html-descriptions.yml.long:
Title of the volume of the item or container holding the item.
Also use for titles of periodical special issues, special sections,
and the like.

schema/html-descriptions.yml:
Disambiguating year suffix in author-date styles (e.g. “a” in “Doe,
1999a”).

items.description: be at least one of: a string, an object

script.description: be at least one of: at least one of: a string, an object, an array of values, where each element must be at least one of: a string, an object

stylesheet.description: be at least one of: a string, an array of values, where each element must be a string
